text:
We have big group of 12 for the office outing lunch. I would said for the number of people we have, the service is not the best but good enough. Only one of our members get the food late. The close out may need to work on it. Tip was added since we have large group which may my bill easy. 

I have order the lamb kebab (Shish Kebab) plate. It come with two choices of side. I got the rice and the babaghanoush. The rice was well cook and nice aroma. The babaghanoush was well prepared and great with extra olive oil. The presentation of the dish is pleasant. However, the meat did not measured up. It was too dry and the marinated is not over the top. They need to improve on this area. 

I have been here several time. My previous experience is better. During the month of Ramadan, they serve the buffet that are plenty of choices and attractive. I would said try them during this time. The buffet of Ramadan usually start at 8:30. Go early because is a lot of customers.

My wife's pick this place since we have a coupon to use. Like RJP said "blame it to the wife". Love to do it when you can get away reasonable doubt by saying wife pick the place. A lot eye candy in the restaurant with my wife. Strange.  

My wife was at the restaurant first and she order ahead. I follow to the restaurant in 10 minutes. She order the lunch special with Chinese stir fry. Chinese food in winghouse? May be not. Her food came out like frozen section ready to cook meal from the Publix. I would not go for their Monday special. 

They have two selection of fish sandwich in the menu. Grouper cousin or Mahi Mahi. Grouper cousin is one type of white fish. I definitely go for the real name fish- the Mahi Mahi. It can be grilled, blackened or deep fried. I have it grilled. The blacken Mahi Mahi is not the spicy type I like but it do have a good taste. This sandwich is better than their daily special. 

The service is average. However, I think they need to be faster for lunch. Most people only have one hour.

This is my second time here. They are open at the Christmas Day night. Not too busy compared to many other restaurant open at that day. The interior of this place is beautifully set up. I like their decorations. 

We were sit immediately on second small room. Including us is about three tables of customers. We have ordered Black pepper basil crispy duck and Spicy noodle with squid. Food delivery is on time. The black pepper basil squid is average. The spicy noodle seem like not cook in high heat because I cannot taste the burn oil. Both dish is actually made for American Thai flavor. The local may like it but I am looking for good Thai which is average. 

The service is not measured up. We were not able to get attention of our waitress. But the other two tables was able grab her attention. Some how we got ignored. The three stars for the food and the service we have experience.

Fancy fast food chain. A lot of choice for the sandwiches. Today I have the shave prime rib basket with upgrade to onion ring ($1 more) and my wife have the Atlantic cod basket with upgrade to shake ($2 more).

They give you a number and the food was brought to the table. This is plus that you don,t need to wait for your order at the counter. The food came in 5 minutes. 

The shave prime rib is a bit salty. The onion ring and the cod came with a thick fried beard coating at the cover. To do the coating for deep fried have two method. The wet flour with material then fried or dry flour with material then fried. This restaurant chose the wet coating. As a result there is oil in the coating if you don't sit the food for a while and serve. 

The service is good. However, I am not a fan for the wet coating. I believe the restaurant can improve on this front.  I not against the fry food but against the oily food due oil residue can be tasted at the onion ring coating.

Desi located at telecom park. Which they can get a lot Hindu customers who work on IT at this commercial park. They located at the end unit of the plaza which allows them to have some outdoor seating. During the weekday, they serve Tali plate. Weekend they serve buffet for lunch. 

The buffet have a lot meat selection. I like the mutton curry. Among the meat curry, I also like their chili chicken and the chicken curry. Tandoori chicken is also good there. They have served different biryanis. But I like the noodle. One thing special I can said is the shrimp curry. It is interesting. 

Overall the price is at the high side. I do not get the wow factor. But I can tell you they don't make it less spicy because of Americans. They did spicy the food which suppose to be. I would give them 3.5 star f

I have book mark Honu for some time. Honu is Hawaiian Green Sea Turtle which is remarkable creature. They have plenty of the decoration about this type of turtle at their wall. Those are cute turtle picture on display. 

We were there New Year eve and they are the only few still have space for 6:30 sitting. We were plan to eat there and go to the New Year show. We start with the Musubi - sautéed spam in seaweed and rice. Very interesting. The second dish is the special of the day with salmon poke and thin piece rice cake. This is interesting dish too. We have the stack - slow cook pork on sushi rice top with claw slaw. The rice is not my liking. The pork are sweet. The final dish Mauna Kea Keck II - slow cook beef on the spinach with twin scoop of rice. The beef is average. The rice definite needs improvement. 

Overall the service is very good. The dishes presentation are well design. However the food seasoning and taste is not there. I like the live music and dollar champagne for good New Year celebration.

This restaurant located in the Hilton Garden Inn near airport. This is interesting to see a restaurant in the hotel. We were here for lunch. The food is not cheap for lunch and dinner after we look at the menu. As long they can provide a good food. We are good. 

We order the chicken panini and the Margherita Classic. The panini is good. Chicken was grilled. Accompanied fries was crispy. The Margherita is a flatbread top with chop steak with mozzarella cheese. It very good. Overall the food is good. The wait is a bit longer for the food. 

The reason is three stars is due to waiter didn't pay attention to the table. Even we try to flag him down. Lunch during office hour usually is short. They need to paid attention we try to paid and get put. It take us ten minutes to finally get his attention.

I have a late lunch here. I walk into the restaurant at 2:20 pm and they have two table occupied. I was sit immediately. 

The furniture is a bit old. The table is a bit sticky. The waiters were nice and courteous. I got the steak taco with rice combo. It is $9.95. The food came out in 10 minutes. The tortilla is a 8 inches flour tortillas. It is big and they have to stick the tortilla with toothpick. The steak is regular steak nothing fancy. No special cut section. It is definite good with fill up you stomach. They guacamole, cheese and salsa for the add on. 

The rice is nicely cook and typically prepared. Before the meal come, they provide the chip and salsa. The salsa came in a small dish. It is easily finish with less than 10 scoops. I have to ask for more. 

Overall is not the five star restaurant. Service is good. It is done that check off deal.

If you looking for meat, they have deal in the store. I got beef flank steak only for $4.95 a pound for the special of the day. It has many types of beef and pork cut. 

The meat market serves hot deli such as empanadas, tacos, fried chicken and more. The price of those deli food are affordable. It has package deal. For is ok since the price is low no complaints. They do have the seating area if you decide to eat there. 

The veggies section just like normal supermarket and same as the can good and un perishable food. They do have special soft drinks. Some from drink still at original bottle packaging. 

This store just like typical supermarket but is local own. The advantage is the meat they have sold here. If you have huge party at your home and hosting a BBQ, this is a good place to purchase your meat.

Sushi burrito is new thing in the recent food world. Basically is poke in a wrap. This handheld is new to people as comfort food. It has good attraction to many people try to catch the trend. I am also one of them. 

I got the original sushi burrito. It has tuna, tempura shrimp, asparagus and more. You can choose the sauce. It is wrap with very soft skin eatable wrap. This burrito to me is like something you need it quick. It look like blue color lunch but cannot be made for hours wait and eat due to raw fish. 

I also got durian boba. The cup indicated Ha Long Bay. I am guessing this restaurant is relate to the Ha Long Bay restaurant. Not much of service. Basically order at counter and wait for your food.

Ava is well decorated to match the younger generation. I like the decorations. However I don't like chair with cross vinyl support seat cushion. I like the bar area is well lid in color. This restaurant is selling atmosphere. 

We have ordered the seared duck breast and the spaghetti e vongole. The duck breast is with the cherry sauce on top of the pistachio goat cheese. The combination is ok if you like goat cheese. It will better with grilled veggies. The spaghetti e vongole is spaghetti with little neck clam. It is white wine sauce. I have this dish at elsewhere. The current experience is not top that previous experience. The wine sauce can be better. 

I can see that why they are not above average. The portion of the food is small compared to many restaurant. It is almost need additional food after we have finished eating. Value is not there and the taste not measure up to the price is charge.

I have to agree with Mark on this taco truck. We have try variety of tacos but this truck is average. I would said the Bay Area certainly step up on the taco food. The tacos have growing interest in this bay area. 

We have order 8 different taco. Including shrimp, lengua, tripa, carne, chorizo, pork. The food is average. I would said the sauce has over power the ingredient. If they can lightly season and still make it taste good, that will be the key. May be I not use to this type of taco with overpower sauce.  We also order the ceviche. The ceviche is better. The crispy corn tortilla go very well with the ceviche.

This deli is order at the counter and issue an order number.  Then you a fix you number to table stand. That how they identify your order and deliver to you. Table and seat is pick by you. It has freedom of your table choice. I like that concept of fast food order. They bring the food to you. 

The menu is very simple. Mainly is the sandwich. Nothing fancy. We got the Black Angus Beef Club. The club sandwich come as four pieces of bread cut in triangle with beef slide sandwich. The bacon can be improved to a bit crispy. This item may be one of the most expensive items. Taste is ok. 

We waited about 8 minutes for our food to deliver to our table. Not much of service

It is huge improvement when there is staff members help you to get the right order. A beeper was given when your food is ready to pick. At least they no longer let the customers to figure out the food on the counter. 

We were here for the taco week to celebrate the administrative day. Most of my guest got two tacos and a drink with about $10. I got the grilled fish and grilled shrimp. It is tasty for the two tacos I have selected. I like the grilled shrimp better. It has some blackened seasoning on it. 

I got the margarita for my combination deal. The margarita start light then feel the alcohol effects later. We enjoy our time there.

Among the three MD, this may be the least favorite. This MD under the major face lift and added many footage to the store. They has increased the good carrier and display with close to 100%. A big applause to the owner. 

Adding is good. But renovation is still needed. The live seafood section need to clean their tank often. The MD in this location employees training need to know how heavy a bag can carry. Today I have two break bag due to the over weight of the bag can carry. They should learn double bag or less items in the bag. 

It is good to see the fresh produce. I like the different fruit items. I like them added the bakery items. This place is more complete now.

We have brunch here during one of the Sunday. I like beach community restaurant because of the Pass A Grille beach. This restaurant is basically at the Main Street. The restaurant decorated modern contemporary. Decoration color mainly white. 

We have group of people. I got the eggnog waffle that top with strawberry and syrup. The waffle also come with the roasted walnut. This dish is decent. I also has the bowl of soup with southern clam chowder. Not much of clam. And the clam is tiny. My friend order the tuna melt. It was not melt at all. The cheese still at the room temp shape. Never melt. Then why call tuna melt. 

Service is a bit slow here. I would give them an average among the restaurant.

This is a difficult one. Among the wine bar or kitchen they are in the passing grade. Very close to the 3.5 stars but not there yet. I think the food need to step up among the wine bars. Selection of the wine is just average. 

There are several thing they can improve. The portion of the plate is small compared to the Bay Area wine bar kitchen. Food pallet is at the sour side. If they can improve this two, it may be great attraction to the customers. Food price on the small plate is at the high side. Flavor and taste still need big improvement. 

I have the blacken octopus and seared tuna. The octopus is one tentacles. Which is small for the price they charging. The sauce can be more complicate by not stay on one sauce. May be grilled a bit better. The seared tuna coating can be improved. Not impressive. It is almost like Japanese tuna sashimi. If the outside is seared, it can include some awesome seasoning. May be smaller cute but more piece which provides more are of the seared outward tastes. 

Overall, they are try to sell the wine which the taste of the food need to be more attractive.

I have been to this Zeko before but have not try their chicken wing. Zeko is a Mediterranean restaurant. They have variety menu. From vegetarian to meat kabab. Their extensive menu includes Greek salad, falafel, fried seafood including shrimp and fish, different kind of shake, beef and lamb kabab, gyro, shawarma, chicken sandwich and wings. 

The restaurant operate like fast food fashion. Order at counter and ready to pick up. After 8:30 pm, most order are take out. I got the honey BBQ wings. The wings is fried and toss over the BBQ sauce. The wing value is $1 a piece is at the average in the Bay Area. Toss sauce with fried wing is not my most favorite. They are just average. 

Overall experience is good. It is definitely better than the fast food in Busch garden.

We were here for the restaurant week at Saturday. For Saturday night this restaurant is average busy. The tap house has good collection of whiskey. They have quite a selection if you want some southern whiskey. They can consider sport bar. I would they may need to add a few more in order to compete as sport bar. 

The service is good. I like the appetizers and the dessert. Their entree need to be work on it. We started with the knockout shrimp. This is fried shrimp with spicy creamy sauce. This serve over the cabbage salad. Our dessert is the chocolate bourbon cake. I also like this dish. The cake has good flavor with ice cream. 

Our entree are the 6oz filet mignon. The meat taste like sirloin instead of filet mignon. It is not soft enough. The meat also has no seasoning. We also has the grilled mahi-mahi. Again no seasoning. Both dish are not impressive.

This restaurant has good potential. They do have a lot of visitors during weekdays. It is a good sign that the restaurant is pack during Thursday. We came in with no reservation. Since we don't like to seat outside, the only seat available is the two couches chairs. We don't mind. It is just not our normal eating height. 

We have order the Carne Asada Street Taco. This taco come with skirt steak, Cotija cheese, and pickle. We don't know the Cotija cheese is. Very similar to goat cheese. This kind of cheese either you love it or hate it for the taste. I think this is a wrong move for the restaurant. Because you may have 50% of people don't like it. Steak is a bit over cook. 

Our second dish is the Chimichurri Steak Frites. This dish is a lot better. We order the medium rare. A few thing can improve on is the temperature serving below warm. The dish is serve over wood cutting board is not my standard. I know they try to create the impression. But for me I don't like to eat with cutting board already being cut through with a lot of cut mark below. Even though the board is clean but never guaranteed if the cut mark is fully clean. I prefer it to serve of the plate. 

With that price charge for the dish, we will have high expectations. However it was not met. Services is great. Good attentive service. I like the decoration and atmosphere. Parking very limited when the place is full.

This my neighborhood Chili. Very Caliente. When we walk out at 8:30 pm, there are people waiting to get a table. Popular for the local resident.

I always like chili fajitas. But lately they have change about the meat cut. The seasoning is still there. Today the flour tortilla is about a bit dry. Which mean they have not steam it completely. This just need a few second more and they will be ok. My wife have the chicken pasta. It is good taste. 

I always start with strawberry lemonade with my soft drink. At the refill, I am asking to change to blackberry ice tea then change to mango ice tea. Sometime they have watermelon lemonade. I have 3 different drink in one order. The strawberry lemonade also dilute down. They use to have the strawberry seed. Now they don't. 

The service at the bar area is quick.

We always love to go to Cracker Barrel on thanksgiving day. Because they are the few restaurants that open that day and serve thanksgiving meal. This year we did not do the sit down lunch due to pandemic. We know the restaurant probably pack. As a result we order to go. 

They have make adjustments for the pandemic for how to pick out the the food. They informed you that there is a tent outside for the curb side pickup. When I arrived I went to a line for the pickup sign. Soon realized they do have two different line. One for the large meal tray pickup and the other for to go pickup. This area they need to improve. At to pickup, I ask if I should stay in the car, the told me line up at tent area will be faster. I think they really to to be effective and efficient which they did not do it. I still have wait at 15 minutes on line to pick up food where my food was ready sit on the counter. They could have changed ready pickup line and order to go line. 

Food is good with a lot of side for the thanksgiving meal. I like my tradition with the restaurant. They do need to improve the online order which crash that day.

For food vendors in the heights market, they have a line during lunch time. The popularity bring good business to them. The food is good in compare to all vendors in the market. I know their breakfast sandwich is popular. Many people get that item. 

I just want to try their top item. The Palomilla Steak. It is most expensive item in the menu. The steak is good. But base on my previous stay in Miami for 11 years, this dish need work. That do not measure my taste buds. The steak needs to be thinner and more flavor. Need some burn taste too. The side item is better. Other than that. All is good.

I was looking forward for to try this restaurant happy hour items for long time. This will be our progressive dinner stop 3. When I walk into the restaurant in Sunday, they still serving the happy hour items. Since this is stop 3, we order the appetizer. They has this deal 4-7 Tue to Friday, Monday all day, Sunday 2 pm to close and Saturday from noon to 7 pm. Very extensive. 

We got the grilled oysters and the clam casino. The oyster is top with cheese. I said is just average. The clam is better. The clam bacon, pepper and onion. This dish worth the try and drive from far distance. I notice their happy hour items included fillet mignon kabab and other interesting app. You also can go full meal for $15 with crab cake, fillet mignon kabab, coconut shrimp and more. Good deal. 

Sunday they have brunch for $20 including two drink. Not bad. The place is nice with bar. Seating area has it own TV. Nice treatment.

I have been many Latin Cafeteria, this one is average. However, they do have a few items that is stand out. The pig stomach soup and the whole pig Lechon - roast pig. The roast pig is good here. The skin is crispy if you for a piece to try. It must roasted in the long hours. The marinated sauce when inside the meat. Consider this is a must try dish if you visit. They may be the only one who serve the pig stomach soup I found in Latin cuisine. It is good and soft. The Chinese cook it with whole black pepper, the Latin cook it yellow base soup. It take some skill to cook this dish. 

The reason they are three star is the rest of the item do not stand out. The rice is under cook. The plantain is not soft enough which mean the did not do a correct selection of how ripe it need to be. The octopus Ceviche is blend. Need more spice. Service is average since is cafeteria style.

Lee House is Center located in Brandon . They have dim sum menu but we did not try it. My neighbors table order the Hong Kong style egg noodle wonton soup. They seem to enjoy it very much. I also notice they run out the last bowl of this soup that night. 

We select the item at the last page menu with three courses for $25. Not a bad deal. We have the salt and pepper squid, grouper with XO sauce, and beef chow fun. The dishes is big and good for hungry people. The squid is in wet batter coating  which I am not a fan. But the other two dishes did a good job. 

I notice they have delivery. I have read one of friend review about 2.5 hour delay story. I think their delivery is not reliable. So come to eat at the restaurant. I can see not consistent in this restaurant since they run out of material. The day we visit is ok service.

Very nice restaurant located between the two counties. It has very nice light green color theme. It has outside seating that is pleasant to the customer. 

They are Mediterranean restaurant in Greek cuisine. They have good veggies dish. It include the grill veggies plate. The daily special for lunch is under $10. Kid menu is available also with little people pricing. 

I have grilled lamb feast. It came with salad and basmati rice. The lamb is not cut in cube at stick. It is big piece lamb meat. As a result, there is a lot of fiber in the meat and it is not tenderize. It is tough to bite. The salad is nice. The food smell good. I would try other dishes if I visit again.

We saw this posting in yelp for this old ice cream store. There are limited parking spots near the store. Fortunately we came to the store when it rain and 9:00 pm at night. Not many cars. 

We are thinking about the dip top ice cream that was posted in the Yelp site. My wife has the Dip Top and I try the snow cone. The snow cone has the choice of Orange, Blue Raspberry, Grape and Cherry. I have them infuse all four flavors. The taste flavor is good but the shave ice is not to the standard. This store shave ice is big pieces compare to many snow cone venders. The correct way of the shave ice is tiny pieces like puffy cotton. I believe they can adjust many revolutions with slightly press to create that. Unfortunately, the store tries to save energy, and make the shave ice not delight to eat. With that, they should have 2 stars.

However, the Dip Top did the best job among the menu and save the day. The soft serve with the Cherry dip top is handsome looking and delicious to eat. I think they are the best in town. If I come back, I will have the dip top only. The soft serve can be vanilla, chocolate or swirl of two flavor. The dip top can be chocolate, cherry or butterscotch. I bite the dip top of my wife and they are excellent.

This food truck is strategically positioning themselves next to Futbol 5. It generates some business from the soccer player who play there. The night time soccer allow the food truck to open till late in the hour. 

This truck sell arepa, cachapas and weekend special. I have the shrimp arepa. You have a choice of cold or hot arepa. The hot arepa is the skin will be fried. I have the hot arepa with shrimp. The shrimp size is big and they many count of them. The arepa is $7. However, the vinegar is overtop the good taste. I actually don't like too much vinegar on food. They should ask the customers if they like it. 

The special of the night include black beef, quail egg, and some other stuff that is very interesting. The food need to eat immediately to gain the maximum enjoyment.

Almost 3.5 stars restaurant but not quite. This restaurant do have excellent reviews but my experience did not match up the rated stars. 

The Sun City has a lot Mexican restaurant that you can pick. Los Amigos is the popular one at local. I think they are highly rated because of the local.  We were here at 1:20 pm and they are still 80% full. People still coming in after we have sit down. 

It was difficult to get the wait staff attention for getting a menu or initial an order. I have decided to take manner at my own hand to grab one of the staff and ordered immediately. After my order, I saw at least three tables customer walk out the restaurant without order. This is a sign of either not enough staff or lack of attention. 

We have order the beef rib with green enchiladas and breaded steak. My friend breaded steak is average. My beef rib come with three pieces. At least 1.5 pieces is over cook or charcoal. I can see why they are popular because their food is good deal. 

A few things they can improve. Increase number of wait staff. The kitchen staffs may need to paid attention on cooking.

Zukku is one of the popular food vendor in the Heights Public Market. The lunch time is constantly build up the line. I would consider them is food court partition restaurant since they share the common area. This is trendy location for high end food.

A few things I like. The deep red color of Ahi tuna. They have good chef knife skills. They can cut the avocado in very thin slice. The decorations for the sushi is attractive. 

I did not go for the sushi. I order a big poke bowl with two proteins. However, they run out of yellowtail. So go for the tuna only. A few things I don't like. The price is about restaurant price for food court mentality. You have stand in line to get food. The portion is small compared to many of you pick poke. The quality is in the mix review. The meat has good quality but it has a lot of tuna tip end. The meat is not cube size. 

For the price. I expect more. As a result, they are three stars.

This Evo serve the Soho neighborhood. It is healthy choice for the people. However the shop is kind of empty when we visited. Not sure this neighborhood is up to the healthy food. 

We got Mediterranean Lemon Chicken. This dish is a bit plain. The chicken is well cooked but lemon grilled is just average. I like their mahi mahi better. 

Food come out quick. Basically is warm. But I like to be hotter. Not much service. I always like their air fries. It is crispy.

I have been here many time. I am here most of the time is for the snack and happy hour drink. Usually is about 3 pm. Their happy hour dollar drink over at 5 pm. The drive through is easy since the road construction was finished. 

The wait for the drive through is good. Easy access. Not much of wait in the line. If you are at the westbound of the Ulmerton. You need a U turn to get to the location.

I cannot jump in joy wagon to give them five stars. Basically this place is a food court with trendy atmosphere. It is an high end food court if I have to classify them. 

Plus area - Parking is the best in the area. Plenty of the parking place. Variety of the food to attract people is very good. 

Down side - Giant food court. Line everywhere. The price of the food is not cheap. Restaurant level price. It is about 20% more than average. Only one water station. I don't like the table setting. A lot of share table. The table is not clean. We have to clean ourselves. 

This place is a big warehouse for a lot of food vendor. It is a new vibe for the area. I wonder what the summer like in this area. It is going to be hot for the design and set up of the building. I guess we will find out. 

I would pick a place has sit down and order the food. Not sure about line standing wait for your turn.

This restaurant is a landmark. Local have eat here for long long time ago. Even today, many families bring their children and grandchildren to eat here. Many memories was in this restaurant with the picture plastered their entire walls. 

It is not my regular visit restaurant due their odd hour and distance away from my work. I come here when I have an off day. We walk in at 1:40 pm and they are still very busy. If you see a gringo walk in 50% may be tourist. Obama visited this place in 2012. As a result a "Obama" Cuban sandwich in the menu with the way he like Cuban sandwich- add lettuce and tomato.  

We have order the Vaca Frita fried shredded beef and the Tripleta Sandwich. The Vaca Frita is prepare good. Only one thing if they can make the edge of the meat burn a little bit to create the burn taste over pan grilled is better. Compare to many Vaca Frita I have, this is below average. The Tripleta sandwich is good taste. I like the little fried in it. It come with three different meat - ham, pork and shredded beef. This is how it get the name. 

Overall my experience is average. I think the servers are run out of the energy to serve us. They seem tire at the last hour before closing. The whole store seem chaos. Not much to organize. Long line for to go order. Not much of parking space. I believe a lot improvement need to be done. However, the price here is very very affordable. That is how they got their customers.

The cafe is at American Airlines concourse. It occupies the prime center location. We are glad that finally the airport has some great restaurants for people. Mise en Place is one of them. 

The menu is simple. They have flat iron steak sandwich or hanger steak dinner plate. This bring up the standard of the airport dining. I did not order any of that and I got the Mahi Mahi. It is grilled mahi mahi with sweet potatoes, corn and spinach. The stir fry veggies is great. The mahi mahi need work. It need to have burn a bit with less wash sea taste. Unfortunately the Mahi Mahi doesn't standout. If not it can be better. 

Service is good since the bar has easy access to food he server. Food came out quick and allow me to boarding with plenty of time.

It is about 3.5 stars restaurant. The restaurant opened the door 10:00 am. I was the 10:45 for lunch. I was surprised they already serve lunch. They have the stand alone building with a lot of parking. 

I got the beef combination pho and the bean and jelly drink. The price is at the mean level. The combination beef noodle is good and refreshing. The soup lack off in compare to other place is the beef tender and beef brisket. These are the item you found on most combination pho. 

The bean jelly drink is delicious. The mung bean is great. The red bean is whole piece. I rather it grind like paste. Overall the service is quick because I am the only one there.

Arepa and Pitas make up the restaurant name. This is a new concept of the combination of two country food for the fast food. If they are successful, they can be like other fast food chain selling their franchise. 

I stop by for a snack to try them on. I have the arepa with the Shawarma beef. The beef is slice and in shawarma sauce. I have added the hamus, lettuce, and cucumber. The beef is a bit dry for me but the  marinated meat is there. My wife like it however I just it is just worth it. This concept of the selection of assembly may work or may not work. So I cannot fully said the restaurant do not have the right ingredient because the customer makes decision on the assembly. 

For the reason above, partly is customer and partly is restaurant I cannot fully make the decision on the food. But base on the keeping the material warm and juicy I am grading it worth a trip with 3 stars. There are thing can be improve such as come out a suggested assemble item that is work and taste good so the customer will not make mistake. This is vital for new concept restaurant to survive and get repeat customer. Good thing is their price is affordable.

This new place has promise future. Great concept for a dessert spot in the New Tampa area. They are in the Pointe plaza. They just open not long ago. I think this is a crucial time to attract customers to repeat visit. 

I like the concept of ice cream and cup cakes. They have an item with the mix of cup cake and ice cream together. We did not try that. We did try their ice cream. The price is at the high side of the ice cream per scoop. One positive thing is we like their ice cream flavors whit different taste than most of the ice cream place. We got the strawberry and salted caramel crunch. The flavor is great potentials. 

As I said, they just open. The ice cream scoop up is just peeling through not entire scoop. It is kind of small for two scoop with almost $7. The price is at the high side. To attract more customer need to be generous at the beginning. Second, most item is almost sold out when we visited at 8:30pm. They need be able to have customers try everything what they can do. Need to have a good start.

It take a long drive from New Tampa to this restaurant just to try it out. Since we're are visiting the Citrus Park Mall, may be a good idea to come here for the book mark we have. 

Arrive the restaurant at and the waitress ask us to sit any where you like. After sit down and ready for the order, four of the regular show up. The restaurant waitress came by and said since we have not order, can we move to smaller table. I am ok to move but there is another table can sit four behind me. Just don't understand why we have to move. I would said for this situation, they need to give us a free appetizer if we do a favor for them. 

Forget about the situation. Let concentrate on the food it self. Our food come out after the four people who took our table. We have order the the lamb kabab. The food only have six ounces on the grilled lamb. It accompanied with fresh salad, hummus, roasted potato and rice. Among all the rice is the best. Overall taste is good. 

I would give a 4 stars for the food. But value is not there for $14.59 dish with 6 ounce lamb. A bit in the high side. Service is below average. Treatment for new customer 2 stars.

It is about 3.5 stars. The food is simple and easy to order. During pandemic, the social distancing was observed. The restaurant is located at the prime area of river. May be they can add outdoor seating with river view to increase attractiveness of customers for margaritas and more. 

We got two taco, the Lengua and Cabeza. This two taco is good. Portion is small. I like cabeza better. The nest dish is steak quesadilla. It was not fully packed. But the price did match the quantity of the meat. Good melt cheese. The last dish is the mixed fajitas. It has chicken, shrimp, and steak. I would suggest if you order, just the steak is good enough. The steak has good marinated sauce in it. It come with fried bean, salad, and rice. 

Overall the price fare to match the quantity. In Chinese saying, one cent price match one cent goods.

Before any mini donut, this shop has serve Gourmet donut for many years. As today it still serve the famous donut nut just to the high school across the corner, many has come here for the donut. They are famous on the bacon maple donut. This is their best seller. 

When we have visited the store, they run out of bacon maple donut. I choose other options. I have the new chocolate banana. It is drizzle with chocolate and the filling is banana flavor. The chocolate touch is ok. The infill is better. I am use to Bavarian creme but banana creme is better. 

My wife has the apple fritter. This is a strange donut but interesting. When we visit them, they almost closing up the store. So the donut has been sit for some time. I will reevaluate them when I revisit them. The only complaint is they close at 12:00 everyday. This is only morning business.

I like old Channelside better because of more buildings. The ideal with open space is good but the ship container really did not display the beauty of the place. I like the open view with seating and view for the bay water. Some how they have least to offer. It just look cheap with current look. I like the bathroom and security everywhere. 

It is great for family with open space but we miss the courtyard. It is try to be hip but not totally hip. Something is missing. Food selection like street food and we have a few spot in Bay Area which compete off. Not sure change for good but definitely not better. May be great for new year eve fireworks. But just one day out of 365 days.

I was attracted by their creative flavor. This is the branch ice cream store from YBOR city. They have the corner lot which is perfect for the customers to hang out and enjoy the ice cream at outdoor side lawn. They do have seat in the store and front of the store if you decide to stay at eat. 

Today they have the new flavors with frosty candy cane for the holiday season. I also heard the friend of my like their guava pastelito so we try one of that. I also go with the crowd favorite the chronic popcorn. Because of pandemic, they don't have the taste try. So I order three scoop. Not cheap for the scoops. But each scoop is big. I ask if they can separate it. They said we have to get all three in tiny bowl. If not I have to paid three individual scoop cost. I would said the three scoops mash together is not good. Flavor mixed up. With no taste try, I can tell you 2 out out of three are not my favorite. I would throw away the other two. The best is still the crowd favorite the chronic popcorn. 

With above reason, the about 2.5 stars. Next give a bigger bowl when I ask for it to separate the scoop. The request is reasonable but they did not provide it.

We are trying their lunch instead of breakfast here. Just want to see how it was incomparable to many breakfast place serve lunch. 

The store location located in a very busy plaza during lunch. All this due to many restaurants are at the same plaza. Parking is a challenge during lunch. 

The line was not long and we got our order in rather quickly. Many have come to here for take out. The food also come out quick. I got the jalapeño cheese bagel with egg, bacon and cheese. The food come out warm. I was thinking if I am eat here, I would at least get temperature hot sandwich. Not so. 

I like their ice coffee. I got the vanilla sweet cream cold brew. The size compared with the price to paid  is at the high size. Good coffee. 

Overall experience is a par. Can be better if you dine in.

I like this restaurant because they are most affordable in the area. The price is reasonable with amount of food they have provided on each dish. Basically the amount is good mother and a child or two older person. For young adult is plenty. You will not go hungry after visit. 

The downside of the restaurant is every thing take too long. It take more 10 minutes after they drop the menu and come to take your order. Often they forget to bring what you need for additional things. The service did take a back seat in this restaurant. It is not they don't have enough help, it just the mentally slow in this restaurant. 

I got the sautéed palomilla with Mofongo. The first taste is great when dig the outside of mofongo. After you get to the outer layer, it lost the best taste. The palomilla I prefer it to be grilled instead of sautéed. However, they don't have this option.

I was here for a take out. They have BBQ grilled in the store. You can see your meat grilled in front of you. This restaurant is local favorite. Other than BBQ, they also has some southern food in their special menu. 

You can get any BBQ meat and add in the rib with each bone with $2 extra. I got the half chicken and extra two bone of BBQ rib. This come to $15 with tax. Not cheap. The chicken I think is to dry and a bit of sit on the grilled for too long. Not juicy at all. But the rib was good enough to have. Our meat come with cob of corn and BBQ baked beans. I like the baked bean because it has southern sweetness. I would only recommend only the rib for this place. 

After order take 10 minutes wait.

Endless sushi is truly endless if you going for the all you can eat. The interior decoration is very nice and modern. This is the place for two person can have the romantic date. This all you can eat concept is a copy from the other Japanese restaurant in New Tampa. They will be judged and compared to the similar restaurant. 

Tonight we are trying this restaurant because they are recently open and new in the Bay Area. We have dinner buffet and they limited each person to 8 pieces of the sashimi if you have dinner buffet. The Sunday dinner buffet is $17.99 not $15.99 per the web site. Tonight we have order the following:
Spicy Tuna Roll - 2 Stars
Spicy Salmon Roll - 2 Stars
Shrimp Tempura Roll - 3 Stars
Rainbow Roll - 3 stars
Crazy Roll - 3 stars
Lady In Red Roll - 3 stars
Saki Roll - 4 Stars
The Coconut shrimp should not be calling in that name. Most recognize coconut shrimp is fried with coconut flake. This is just the wet flour coating fried with sweet mayo. It is different than my friend Rachel M. posted picture. I wonder they start changing their quality. The Hibachi squid is not near to the standard with most hot plate includes the minor burn of the squid. The sashimi is better since they are base on the cut. The best of the sashimi is the surf clam. This is the most value of the dish. The hibachi tofu is perfect for taste and texture. The fried scallop is not the true scallop - disappointed. Age tofu is OK. 

This section is to evaluate the chef skill and material. The spicy tuna is process with food processor. As a result, they are lumpy. The correct way is to chop in pieces and mix with correct spice and quail egg. By chopping it create the texture of the tuna and preserve the quality. The food processor just a short cut. Same as the spicy salmon is process that way. After I eat the sushi, I can smell the fish smell around my lip, although they are fresh but they are not the best quality due to the smell. They should not call out coconut shrimp or scallop to give customer a misconception where they are not prepare in those ingredient. 

This restaurant will require a lot of improvement not just the chef skill. They also need to improve the flavor of each roll to show it is not too plain. I am thinking this restaurant is 2.5 star bases on the comment above but I am given three stars. I hope they can have dramatic improvement for the next time I am visit.

I have been to this restaurant many times. Some time I bring my boss here since he like sushi. We have our office celebration here over the hibachi table. Some time we got good hibachi chef have a lot trick some time it just ordinary hibachi chef. Some time you catch the food that the chef threw at you. 

When I come here, I like to have the dancing crab roll, Koizi roll, spicy tuna roll. There is roll call sexy girl roll. This is spicy sexy roll with spicy tuna and tempura shrimp with spice mayo. No sure the name matches the roll. We usually come at lunch because is all you can eat with lesser price compare to dinner price. 

The reason I give 3 stars due to current quality of the restaurant drop. Food is still good but they are not as good at the first year they open the restaurant. The service is still good. The hibachi chef is base on your luck. Sometime you get a good chef.

The outside sitting at this month is very pleasant. Blue sky no cloud and you not in hurry while you enjoy your lunch. Our office decided to celebrate a win of project at this restaurant. This restaurant is the seventh series of famous Columbia restaurant. The lunch menu is reasonable price. Since we have a big group, the outside sitting waiter have a lot to cover. He have a slow start to get our menu. Then the food come out faster then I have estimated. The speed of serving is good after the food is out.  

I have the Mahi Mahi Cayo Hueso.  It is grill Mahi Mahi with mojo marinated. It is good. The soup of chilled gazpacho is taste better than lunch entree. I also ask a dish to go for the coworker that cannot make it. The order is done in 5 minutes. This mean this is cafe style precook items and assemble on site immediately. The temperature of the food is warm and further evident precook item.  This may not be the cook to your order place.

Friday and Saturday night the y have live music at the river front. This may be the best time to take a sip and enjoy.

Been to this place several time but never give a formal review. It is due to undecided what to give this restaurant. Finally settle on the average of the review. 

This restaurant located on the main entrance of the sawgrass mall. I have been here to wait for friend or a drink. It has a nice outdoor seating. It is very nice on the cool month. 

The food is so so. It is actually not a wow factor nor bad. The service is good which keep this restaurant in business. But to compete with the two neighbor bar, they may need to step up on the menu or some signature drink.

Some like Starbucks and some like McDonald. I will prefer Dunkin Donut coffee. They are most reasonable and provide the best taste and value to cup of Joe. Their reasonable price with right coffee bean is choice of selection. I also like their ice coffee and frozen drinks coolata. Those are my favorite. 

Currently they have many types of coolata. One time I got the pumpkin spice coolata at the Halloween. The ice coffee with cream and mocha is my favorite. It is cool like cucumbers. I don't like hot drinks that much. But the frozen drinks and ice drinks are great here. Just like Southeast Asia. 

Donut is just ok. Some time I like their french curly donut. Sugar donut is the best. I really don't like the glazed donut. But the Bavarian cream infill is great. You can order online without wait if you in hurry. Once you have the app, everything can be done online before come to the store. Lessen the wait time.

I have not been in the IHOP for a while. I mean a while is minimum 5 years. We decide to go there have the snack at 10 pm before the cranky night. We have the coupon with free four pancakes.

What I have use to a dish with fried half hen is no longer serve there. The menu is change a lot. It went to tradition American cuisine. I found myself lost looking at the menu. However, they still have different type of crepes in the menu. I love their crepe. That may be the only thing not change. But they did add chicken florentine crepe. I got to try that and they my new found love here. The crepe is cook along side with the wrapping ingredients. The ingredients are chopped chicken breast, spinach, mushroom, onion. These ingredients are stir fry and add on top of crepe then top with Swiss cheese. The cheese melt away and the crepe top with hollandaise sauce. This is creeeeepy day for me. But they are good. 

Overall the pricing with the food some good value and some are not. Service is great.

It was great to see new kid in the block. The name of the restaurant is sound interesting. This is actually a fast food set up. The six major things they are serving is wings, fish, shrimp, Philly cheese, burger and fried rice. Food price is in the middle of fast food chain. 

There are three different fish you can choose. Whiting, Tilapia or Catfish. The catfish will have a dollar difference. I got the fried shrimp and whiting for $9.99 which includes the drinks. Ok deal. My wife have the Philly cheese steak and the six wings with teriyaki sauce. Cheese steak is good. The chicken is fried correctly. Not much can said about the food. They are not wow factor but does the job. No standout taste. 

I do like other than food, you can get specialty drink with boba. We have cappuccino and mango slush. It just need to add the upgrade fees. Overall is good.

Taco. Yes they do serve that. They also has the mixed in bowl. I would said the mixed in is not the the Mexican anymore. It is more into fusion. It is first new concept for the Mexican cuisine. 

I have order the bowl instead go to their taco. Actually I am not a fan of bowl here. The surrounding area already have many bowl systems restaurants. I got the two proteins with fried chicken and fried shrimp. I have guacamole rice and noodles as the base. The veggies are the Brussels sprouts and grilled broccoli. The topping is pineapple and cucumber cilantro. 

The restaurant did attract a lot young crowd. The bowl is just average for the quantity. I can see the bottom of the bowl. So it is not cheap either with the quantity they have. Good for quick lunch. Other than that, no wow factor.

Fancy place to dine. It has a good decorations and great entrance. The salad bar is impressive. With beautiful center decorations arrangement. It is very busy in week day. 

We got into second seating. Our dinner start at 8 pm. Which is perfect for all you can eat. I like the salad bar many item including hearts of Palm, shrimp salad, grill pineapple, and more. I have the lobster bisque at the end of meal. But not impress on it. No shrimp or lobster. 

The meat went on when they bring it to the table. The sirlion and the skirt steak are the best. That all. The rest are too salty. I could not taste the meat. If you pay $$$$ money, the steak or lamb should be better. No fireworks. 

Service is great, meat are below average, salad is good. Been here done that.

It is good to see new branch from Outback Steak House. It want to serve like fast food as for the new concept. Unfortunately their food preparation not fast at all. I have to wait for 15 minutes after order. There is no line on order. But there is a line to wait for the food. This part of business may need to improve. 

Aussie Grill open their business in food court of the Brandon Westfield Mall. It has advertisements at the entire hallways of the mall. It does get a lot of attention from mall goers. I got the seared beef tenderloin and crispy volcano shrimp. I got it medium rare. For the beef. The meat quality is a bit better than average. But I don't like the seared technique. I prefer grilled. Grill will enhance the taste. I do like their volcano shrimp. It was done right.

The actual name of the restaurant is La Gloria Mexican Restaurant. It has Latin dish. But more into Mexican cuisine. The restaurant is quite on the opening hour. During that time, the English communication is limited until a manager show up. But the store clerk is friendly. They allow me to taste what I don't understand in the menu. 

I have carne Asada Plate. This dish come with grilled steak in Mexican marinated sauce. It also accompanied with rice and baked fried bean. The bean was well done. The steak is so so. I also got two tacos. One with the grilled tilapia and the other is grilled shrimp. Both of them look flat on taste. Not much of grilled mark.

Food is average. But they do have some other authentic dish. May be try those. They do have their daily specials on the board. Check those out.

This Mexican restaurant has inside and outside seating. The outside seating area is to accommodate the customers who smoke or with dog. The bar area is at inside serve extensive drink menu with TV. You can enjoy a gameplay there at football season.

I got the Steak Monterrey. This is skirt steak marinated with and grilled. It accompanied with rice and stuff poblano pepper top with habanero pesto sauce. The stuffing is with shrimp, mushrooms, onion over melted cheese. The stuffing is actually my favorite. However, the main item skirt steak is very tough just to cut. It take me a good 3 minutes to chew a small piece. Meat quality is not that good. It the meat quality improved, this restaurant has potential. 

There is plenty server on the floor. You always can get their attention. Service is good. Not sure about the drink. Seem like each waiter prepared their drink order which tell me no set bartender.

Bar Louie is more open connecting to outdoor. But I do not like darker corner when you seat inside. This bar is second stop on our progressive happy hour tour. 

We started with fried calamari. The calamari is a bit tasteless because the coating is not interesting. May be make more floppy and spice with be more attractive. The second item is the chicken quesadilla. This is more interesting. But still this two item are not attractive enough in compare to nearby happy hour restaurant. However I do like the martini. Their signature martini during the happy hour is very good. I have the Diva martini. I like that one. 

I think the drink is better than the food. They really need to work on the food to attract more customers during happy hour.

About 3.5 stars. We visited at 5:30 Friday, the line has not build up yet. We were able to get a table inside. There is not much of service. The person who take order is a bit slow. He just sit at register for taking order but still slow. The kitchen crew are more alert. They got your order and fried the chicken immediately. 

The Nashville style chicken is using wet batter coating systems. Most of the fried chicken place use dry powder battering then fried immediately. This place have coating mixed with spice and wet it with water. The chicken then dip into the wet coating and fried. This system is more challenging. The Chinese fried chicken is like this system. Why they are 3.5 stars is because the coating getting compact and concentrated. Which mean the oil is old and repetitive fried. The fresh oil or change the oil so often will make the chicken better coating. 

One best thing is the seasoning and the Nashville hot is very well receptive. This is not like Asian hot that numb you mouth and could not taste the food. The hot is acceptable by many Americans. You still can taste the hot heat and the food in the right amount of chili. This I would give them an "A". Price is about most fried chicken place. But I do like their fried and the pickle. It was good.

I think this Thai food has potential. It is at good location. The thing need to improve is the wok technique. Other than that, the interior decoration, furniture and service is measured up to 4 stars. 

We started with squid Tom yum soup. Their Tom yum is lean to sweet side instead of sour. The soup is good. We order the Siam Noodle. This is their house special sauce with shrimp and chicken stir fry rice noodle. I think they are just average if this is a house dish. Not attractive. 

We also order a drunken noodle. We order Thai hot but it is not measured up the heat. The noodle not even burn the edge show this stir fry is not quite high heat with oil. Basically they need improvement. If the cuisine can improve, they will be good Thai here in compare to Bay Area Thai food.

This restaurant has high ratings. Consider one of the popular in the area. During lunch time, the restaurant is pack. They are not too far from Highway I-275, as a result I stop here for lunch. 

I got the traditional dish. I got the Bandeja Paisa. It typical Columbian dish with samples of all cooking. The dish includes grilled steak, sausage, chicharron (fried pork belly with skin), sunny side up egg, arepa, rice and bean, avocado, and sweet plantain. This is to show case the entire cuisine. 

Why three stars. The steak not even close to warm. The sausage is powdery. The egg yolk over cook. It is not liquidity. The best of the dish is the chicharron.  It is crispy and good. 

The service is great. It is not bad at all for the price of the dish $13.50. The service is good. If the cooking can improve, they can be easily 4 stars.

It is an interesting Lao's grocery store. I was hope to get some cook food deli like it show on the store front. Seem like the deli did not operate. We enjoy our shopping there. We pick up few item we have not seen before. 

We got crispy fish chip. Interesting looking. They do have meat department. You can get all pig intestines, stomach or kidney in this store. The store also have some homemade dessert you can pick up. The veggies section is small but sufficient. A lot of frozen seafood. 

Overall this market is small. We like some item we have not try before. Good experience.

This is the first gas station exit for I-275 northbound after Sunshine Skyway. If you need gas after the long bridge, this is the place. Price is reasonable by considering this is at the southern part of the Pinellas County. You may guess they can charge arm and leg but they did not. 

The total have twelve pump. Enough to handle the surge of demand. It is easy to get in and out here. It also has plenty of space to maneuver your car around their parking lot. Security cameras is pointing to the direction of the pump which makes this place safe.

Tung- Tung is one of the few Chinese restaurant that do deliver. The food is average but the deliver is very convenient. We work late in night and few hungry this is a good restaurant to call. They are few restaurants in Temple Terrace answer a call for delivery. 

Many of my friend order veggies or chicken fried rice. Mostly American Chinese food. I actually go for true Chinese food. I got the beef chow fun. It got the sauce and correct wok heat to make it delicious. However some of the noodle has not separated on about 5 % of it. However, they are still good. The beef is flavorful but not tender enough. 

Overall they are still good. If we have the delivery again, I will still order the same thing.

Very close other big oriental supermarket. Some of my friend like this place due to great price and good amount of veggies. Thankfully they open during pandemic. They do control amount of people can enter the store to avoid crowded situations. 

The store have only basic oriental items. Definitely is local favorite. Not for me who are out of town people. It has item I need. I would said it is good carry on the butcher section for type of meat you want.

This is the second PDQ that I have visited. It still good on People Dedicated to Quality. The place is clean and neat. The food is still good but not as good as the first one I have been to.

We got BBQ bacon and Hawaiian chicken sandwich.  The Hawaiian is still good. The BBQ just average. It is a bit too sticky. The Hawaiian chicken is still the best.

The side order of zucchini fries was to soggy. It can be better with extra cost for the combo meal. Other than that, everything is good.

Tara is not allowed dine in during pandemic. But the take out is available. The store open to customers who want generous on the quantity portion. 

I got the the stew Oxtail. This dish come with one side of choices and rice. I have the cabbage as side. The oxtail is stew in high pressure to separate from the bone. Number oxtail given was three big pieces and one small piece. The rice was given generously so you will have full stomach. Great for dinner portions. 

Overall experience is at average. Food is ok. Definitely is budget place in compare to many restaurants.

Dominican restaurant that provide a lot vibe and economic dinning for the local. Many people are here for a meal in saving price. We are here to try out the food for the first time.

The restaurant has the two choices for the food. You can pickup by cafeteria already cook or from the menu. We have order two dishes from the cafeteria and one from the menu. The first dish is a soup with tripe, pig feet, and veggie. Most people only cook tripe soup by it own. It is good twist with the pig feet. Good soup. 

The second dish is a tomato base whole fish. It look awesome but it not my liking taste. Fish meat is too loose. The third dish is a cook up dish of grill steak with onion. I can hear they pound the steak at the kitchen. I like my steak grilled with no sauce. But Dominican steak has sauce on top but a bit salty. 

The food is average. If I choose Latin food, I would go with Cuban style bistec. Service is cafeteria style.

La Hacienda is popular among the local. The plaza parking lot always pack. Most car come to this restaurant. Parking is rime here. We were here at 2 pm. The place still pack. We were lucky to get a table. People who behind us have to wait. 

The food is good. I have Paisa Bandeja Hacienda with upgrades steak. This dish has steak, chicharon, blood sausage, regular sausage, rice, egg, plantains, bean soup. A lot to offer. The chicharron is a little tough to bite de to the skin is or crispy. Like rubber. This can improve by changing the frying oil and keep it crispy. The rest item is a little above average. My wife love her dish. She has Filete de Pescado al Ajillo. The Ajillo sauce is great. I would highly recommend this dish. It is one of the kind. 

The reason they are 3 star is the wait for the food is too long. We waited almost 40 minutes. No wonder the restaurant always pack because everyone is waiting for their food. The chicharron is a typical dish which they must master before anything else. I hope my next visit they can improve on that. They have bakery section. To me is just ok. Bit my wife like it.

It is just ok for the BBQ. This place is kind of new at Brandon area. The store front was decorated with Christmas item when I was visiting there. The draw some new paint on the windows showing the Santa clauses and Mrs Clause. 

We got the sampler platter. It got Saint Louis rib, pull pork, brisket, quarter chicken and two sides. The chicken meat is too powdery. The pull pork is too dry. Only the brisket measure up to the standard. The rib is average. May be is off day for them. It is not up to par.

Drive through is sloooooow. It take 3.5 minutes to move a car. If you cannot wait, just walk in to the counter is faster. I figure if you see more than 5 cars ahead of you, just walk in. This store clerk need to process a bit faster. 

Food is good, just service is slow. I believe they can improve on this front. This store now receive a face lift. It was remodel to modern look. It should a new face resolution for this store

They take my order but have to wait for 3.5 minutes. The cooking process also need to speed up. I hope they can improve since they have new look.

Sarge is very close the University of Tampa. They are in the food court sharing with three other restaurants. With their location close to the university, they got a lot of college student visits. 

We got the smokehouse club. The meat do pile up like mountain. This sandwich has the pork, chicken and brisket. It top with bacon strips and the claw slaw. The bacon is not quite crispy. Meat is a bit dry. The sandwich can better if they improve on it. Price is matching the amount of food was given.

This restaurant is like Philippino cuisine with upscale dining. This restaurant located at clubhouse of the tennis club. It is surrounded by 17 tennis court. Mainly serving the people who play tennis here. It is kind of tuck away from main street. 

The restaurant is well set up. Restaurant name is Match Point Grilled. It also call Karma coffee. I was confused at first when I walk into the restaurant. We ordered Kare Kare. This dish serve with traditional oxtail. It come with rice. The quantity of oxtail is less and not matching the price listed. The other dish we have is the Beef Afritada. It is tomato base stew. This dish give a little more beef. It is come with rice. 

We feel the price list are not measure up the food that serve. Food is a bit less of the taste. Service is good. Atmosphere is great. It is kind been there done that restaurant.

May be the dish I have order didn't impress me. I have book mark this place for some time. I was having a high hope for it. Tuk Tuk is rickshaw in Thailand. So this is mobile food.  

The menu show interesting selection. One thing catch my eyes is their crab fried rice. I got one of that. I also got their Thai ice tea. The Thai ice tea has strong enough tea in it. I like it the milk and tea mixed. 

I have the crab fried in Thai hot. It does bring on the heat. But the dish did not impress me for several reasons. The rice is too watery. The tomato put in there actually damp the wetness of the dish. It is not a good combo. The crab meat it spread in thin pieces. It can be chunky. It has crab taste but not really crab meat taste. May be they use the blue crab instead of dungeons. 

Services is average. The initial contact is a bit slow but the close up and paid is quick.

This is for the review strictly about the Poke. Obviously this market located 1 mile away from St Petersburg downtown. This restaurant is located at the neighborhood of Old Southeast, as a result, they call themselves the same name. 

The grocery store's alcohol wine collection has a lot of choices. They do have a wall of soft drink and special drinks in the refrigerator. In the grocery store it has a few seat for anyone who wants to eat there.  

For the poke, since they are situated on the non compete area, it becomes the local favorite. In compare to Tampa Bay Area, they are in the middle of the pack. This is due to competition store has unlimited choices in compare to three choices on the added on. The other place can mixed and match on the sauce. This place has pre set sauce with your choice to add into poke. I have to give them credit some of the sauce are home mixed that other place do not has it. Overall the quantity is just at average in compare other. Add on is so so not quit interesting.

Very new restaurant. I decided to try them on. The restaurant seating is about a little challenge. Inside the restaurant mostly high top except a few is normal level table. If you want to sit at normal level, you may want to choose the outside patio seating. Obviously they try to imitate the beer hall type atmosphere with high top seats but it will be challenging for lady with dress. 

This restaurant is open about a month. They still did not get the kink out. The food wait is about 35 minutes. Waiting staff afraid to approach you since you are waiting for the food. We got the habanero wings and the short rib. The wing is actually Buffalo wing with honey ranch type dipping sauce. I am not impressed due to 8 wings for $11 and is just regular buffalo wing. I expect more for the price paid $1.5 a wing with tax. The name not measure up. 

The short rib is a fan. I like it when they braised it or slow temperature long hour grilled. The out side was crispy and nice. This short rib top with sweet mushrooms sauce with cabbage and place over pancakes. This is a great dish. 

Overall the service need to improve, the food waiting time need to cut down, may be grilled the wing with honey after the buffalo sauce was applied will make this wing worth $1.5 a piece. Happy hour half price weekday 2-7 is a plus.

This restaurant is a Thai restaurant that serve sushi. This restaurant locate near my office. This is a place if I have run for the next meeting after the lunch hour. At night time, live jazz music is performed here. 

Today I have the garlic pepper squid and a cup if the tom yum soup. I always order Thai hot. It is really spicy - sweaty hot spicy. You have to be able to tolerance for hot food is you order Thai hot. I am use to it. To most American, the Thai restaurant medium hot mean very hot, mild mean ok hot. The tom yum soup have ingredient of scallop, shrimp, and squid. The tom yum style soup have the tamarind spice with sour and salty taste. It is perfect, for most people just order the regular so you can enjoy and taste the soup. If not it will be too hot. 

The garlic pepper squid is a stir fry dish. The chef need to prepare the garlic sauce with high wok heat to create the burn of oil and the garlic to create the burn taste. This restaurant is ok on this skill. However, overburn create charcoal taste which you don't want. It is a battle of the risk of the chef not to under cook it or burn it. 

I have sushi here before, I can said that I am not a fan of it.

It is about 3.5 stars. A few things can be improved. Overall is a good restaurant. It is food truck standard in a building with control temperature. Chef has good skill. 

I got the two meat large bowl with steak and chicken combo. The steak is the New York Strip meat. But it is thin slice meat. The bowl is bed with rice. The meat is cook over grilled with Korean BBQ sauce. I have added sunny side up egg. I also got spicy pork to go. I eat half over the restaurant and bring home other half. The food do not sit in my stomach well. I have to go to bathroom. I believe is the egg because I finished the egg in the restaurant. When I eat the remaining, it was good. 

If I am there, I will go for the Bibimbap. Cafeteria style. Not much of service. I would prefer the steak to be dice than thin slice.

The nowait online is good to put your wait list before arrive to the restaurant. It definitely a good help to know when your table is ready. Even with nowait check in. They also loss our reservation. Fortunately they back check it when we were there and give us next available. 

The restaurant is busy because they are the most affordable in Hyde Park. Many teenagers who live nearby are hang out at this place. This restaurant look like old dinner. It has the sixty look. You almost can feel the swing dance party is happen any time. 

The food is average compare to many dinner. I guess that have so many customer due to their affordability. We have order the grilled grouper and Goody goody cheese burger pox. The burger is just average. The grouper is good size but they are pan grilled not flame grilled. The fry come with is soggy. This is not a good fry. I believe the fired oil was not change over time and make the French fry soggy. 

Service is not there. Our waiter was missing for good period of time for our close up. Not sure is worth for the visit. However, been there done there.

It is vey small farmer market. It has some art and craft, food, service, clothing and specialty. It located at Centennial Park of Ybor City. It is at the corner of 9th Avenue and 19th St. Parking is easy along the street side. They have parking lot with the fees apply. 

In the park they are some shaded area with roof cover. This area have a lot vendors and pleasant to walk. Across the street is Ybor City Museum State Park which make this Saturday Market a one stop visit. Among the vendors I like the vendor who sell the indoor plants. This indoor plant has multi color and easy to take care. Just a few spray and close the glass enclosure, the steam form on the glass and create natural indoor steam room. 

There are some clothing, buttons vendors. It was very interesting. Some vendor sell gluten free cake. Not many vendor but have something to offer for everyone.

This restaurant use to be a different Vietnamese restaurant. The interior did not change. The traffic for the patron is good here at 5 pm. At least I see 5 table occupied. 

I got the Hu Tieu. It is a seafood Hu Tieu. It has the squid, shrimp, fish ball, shrimp ball. This dish cost $7.50 for small. I have ask them to add the fish cake also. They have charge me extras $2. It is a 25 % mark up. It is a bit steep. The noodle is good and the seafood is fresh. I think the soup is a bit let down due to lack of flavor and the enhanced of fried onions and fried pork fat.  If they can stir fried the pork fat ant onion before adding the soup, it will enhance the taste. 

Overall is good. Services is average. Nothing to boast about. It is been there done that deal. Pinellas Park has too many good Vietnamese food. It will be a good competition.

Interesting decorations and furniture for interior set up. I would said this is a people hang out place. I saw people play with their iPad or smart phone there. However, it did not give me a feeling of great atmosphere. 

They do have two choices of adult only ice cream. I mean not in the film X rated movie. If you think about that is all you...haha. The adult only is alcohol content ice cream. You need to show the ID before you order. My ID is the grey hair :). I have ordered the pumpkin spice rumchata. The alcohol is actually from the rum.  I would said it is tasty. 

The price is a bit in the high side. If I come back, I would try the porky delight and some of the menu items. They located approximately 2.7 miles from the exit of the I-75 and SR 60. Easy to find.

I was eyes on this restaurant for long time. Every time I pass by there is a long line. Finally a weekday that has no much customers. I was able to walk in and order without waiting. I have it to go. 

I order a palabok fiesta with one non spicy chicken joy. The palabok is rice clear noodle with shrimp, ground pork and egg. It is just an ok dish. The fried chicken joy is better. I also has the spaghetti with two spicy chicken joy. The spicy of the seasoning is actually skin deep. Spaghetti is average. The best among all is peach mango pie. This is their best dish. I would recommend this. 

The order was prepared fast. I really don't like the packaging. It is paper box that is not secure. Especially the food is more heavy than the box can bear. This will be their set back and easy to spill when they not secure properly in the plastic bag with two three order.

My experience is base on the price they charge and the pasta available that day. That day they run out of many things, only two type of pasta available. We got pasta with meat sauce. The process is simple. The only advantage of this restaurant is make the fresh pasta. 

The food is come with paper containers with pasta. Sometime can be messy to reach the last pasta at the bottom. Overall the taste is jus average. I don't see much advantages other than convenience. Price is high for the dish.

This is a 3.5 stars restaurant. It is not yet 4 stars. In compare to many Korean restaurants in Bay Area, I would said they have the most competitive price for their food. Although they are not cheap but is about a dollar to 2 dollars lower different in the Bay Area. 

We have three dishes tonight. We start with Galbi the Korean grilled short rib. The dish is $23 with about 11 pieces of short rib. It was great marinated sauce to the bone. The second dish is the Eemyoonsoo the fried Atlanta Mackerel with lightly salted. This is a whole fish. The size is medium for $17. The edge and top was fried to crispy and crunch. A very good dish to go with beer or rice wine. The last dish is Dolsot Bibimbob. The rice serve in stone bowl. That make the rice burn to crispy at the stone touch edge. This dis has egg, veggies, beef. But I think it is less flavor. They need to work on this dish. 

They are better than most Korean restaurants in Tampa. You still need to wait for the food for a while but the wait time is shorter than the Korean restaurants in Tampa. I still say they need to work on the speed to deliver the food to table. Don't let the customers wait too long. Service is typically as bad as most Korean restaurants.

New Culver with new building, new location, and new market. This will be a challenge to many culver store. It does bring easy comfort food to the area and next to the mall. I have been to 4 culver, it will be comparison among them. 

We are here for buy one get one free ice cream. The coupon is sweet. I have the flavor of the day. It keeps changing every time we're here. The only comment I have is the ice cream melt very fast compared to other location of culver.

Cool name to start the sandwich store. Very systematic to select the sandwich that you want. First identified the name. Then the sandwich of your choice, next type bread, then sauce, last is ingredients include veggies. 

I would said this sandwich store is in the middle of the pack. Because they are systematically layout, they are not flexible to change for their meat selection. For instance if I want just capicola ham only, I will not be able to buy that. I have to select the entire Italian cut including pepperoni, salami. The reason they give is each portion is precut and assembled. You will not be able to twist and change. If I want extra meat, you have to paid entire assembly. 

The sandwich is good taste for Italian, the balsamic sauce is great. But I feel sandwich assembly is thin not wide enough. A meal combo is above $10. It is above medium price range.

Happy hour time with friends in this location. We meet up after work to celebrate. Certainly this Winghouse is the hottest location in Bay Area. 

Tonight is a special night gathering. While we wait for all the friends, I have order a bluemoon. They do not carry Coppertail. Bluemoon is good and cold. We brought a cake to celebrate and the waitress is nice to but it out for us. I have order a smoke BBQ grill wing and two pork chop. The chop is a bit over cook and dry. The chef do not have skill to seal the juice. It accompanied with broccoli and mushrooms gravy with mash potatoes. Food did not impress me. 

The more need to be improved in this winghouse. Table need to be clean, food need to improve and the parking need to be available.

I am excited to try this restaurant. I like to try this hype restaurant with $$$$ for sometime. I hope for top dollar with very good experience. You have a choice to valet for $5 when you are arriving or looking for empty parking in the lot. 

We were planning to try the happy hour before our show in the performance art center. After we have sit down, the hostess tell us the happy hour item is at the bar area or lounge. But they let us sit at the dinning room for happy happy hour item. We have waited them to bring the menu. Later the waiter has come to ask us again then we wait again. We could have gone to lunge area and be done with it. 

We have ordered the lamb lollipop, lobster roll, and the charbroiled oyster. The lamb come in three big pieces with good quantity. The oyster is only three pieces a bit less. The lobster roll I have better elsewhere. The taste did not wow me. 

The ending to pay the bill is quick no wait. I was expecting a lot from this restaurant but did not get the value we paid. Good restaurant but they can be great.

The BBQ place located in a rough neighborhood. If you want find a good food and don't mind the place, this can be your adventure. King BBQ just off Armenia and I-275. There no place to sit. It is a to go place. 

You may not experience the full menu. It is what they are cooking at that day. Today they just have the regular rib and the chicken. The price is good for the meat you get. I got half slab regular ribs for $13. It fill the entire box. The middle low part of the rib was grilled to crispy and not burn. It is very tasty. They do have the BBQ sauce selection with mild, mixed or hot. I have them put the sauce on the side. Since this is full size rib not baby back, the half slab look big.  

The BBQ store is walk in and the grille just in front of you. You can see what you order. They will chop it for you for easy bite.
