I want some snack after the exercise. It is also the football Monday night. So I decided something quick with wings. I think Kentucky fried chicken may be a good choice. 

Recently they have the $10 bucket with a choice of fried chicken, popcorn chicken or wings. I have selected the wings. The drive through is easy since there was no one in front of me. I got my order in two minutes. Nothing better than that. 

The wings are fried correctly. Occasionally the have thick crust. The wings is a bit small compared to many wing place. I have 12 wings for $10 and with tax is about $0.90 per wing. It is average cost. In compared to I have Dry Rub wing for $0.80. I would said this is a three stars.

This is Vietnamese fast food in the mall. This is first of it kind. It you have to choose a mall fast food, I would go for the pho which is more healthy and easy. They are located next to the carousel in the mall. 

They have quite a selection for the type of pho you like. It include the seafood or fish ball noodle soup. I have the meat ball and slice rare beef noodle soup. Soup is good. They may not be the best in the Bay Area but it is good enough for the mall.

They also carry different type of boba smoothie. I did not try their boba but my neighbor boba look very good. 

The service is good. The sale person very patient explained to me each item. The only down side is each item is prepared in package. I like to mix and match which will make thing more interesting.

I would said this is the best Philippino restaurant in the Bay Area. It is a mix with grocery store and the restaurant. I can see the problem of this restaurant is the response time to the customer. We sit down for 10 minutes before anyone come to ask what I need. In fact, there was no one out at the front for good 10 minutes. We help ourself for the menu. 

We got our orders immediately once we have someone come to our table. The food came out very quick. We order the Binagoongang Baboy - pork with shrimp paste. It you are not use to shrimp paste do not try this dish. I like this dish since the pork are well braise and soft. If they cook this dish with hot chili, it will be much better. 

Our second dish is the most popular dish of the restaurant. It is Da-Long-Tocilog combo. It is a breakfast dish that serve all day. It has fried pickle fish, cure pork meat, pork sausage serve with garlic fried rice and fried egg. This is a very good dish. 

The food is 4 stars, but the service and attentive of the store front is 2.5 stars. So 3 stars for the restaurant. Do I come back. Yes, for the combo breakfast dish that was not serve else where. It has better menu compare to the Bay Area Philippino food restaurants.

The restaurant service is good. The server paid good attention to our table. She also have knowledge of the menu and daily special. The restaurant is at prime location at the mall entrance. They got very good customer base. The restaurant is 80% pack in the early dinner hour. 

We got two items from happy hour, we have the oysters and the medium neck clam. Both dishes was fresh and delicious. My wife have fish and chips. The fish is in good large piece. It also has crispy coating. It is good dish with the fries. I have the crab cake. I think the crab cake is below average. I think it has too much dough than crab meat. It do come with string beans and rice. The side dish is a choice from menu. 

Overall experience is good. It is about 3.5 stars. I still think if their menu can be re-engineering with attractive dish in use seasoning, cook method, or flavor, they will do very well.

My first take of the pub is great gathering place in Tampa Palm area. Generally it has good seating area. Most chair is high top. May be a bit difficult for the ladies with dress. This pub not populated with TV. It can be more but enough for each corner. 

This pub food and drink price a generally a dollar more than the other pub. The wings after tax is about $1.3x per wing. Average wing price at USF and New tampa is about $1.00. As a result, we expect to be spectacular. I have blacken wing. The wing is fried correctly. The blackened spice is not so. I think can be improved. I wonder if they have grilled stove. If they do the grilled will add flavor into it. That can be improved easily. 

I like new business because they really bring value to the community. In the same time, they need to be reasonable. I know they invest a lot in a business. So far they have the customers and it is time to correct.

I would give them a fair average restaurant. With that said, they did a good job during pandemic period. They put napkin dispenser for you get a piece napkin to open the door without contact. The food are paid online and no touching in the store to exchange payment. Food is put on the table as barrier from kitchen. Base on your order and name you can pickup your order. 

I order the broccoli beef, Kung Pao chicken, mushroom chicken, fried rice, noodle. The broccoli beef I barely see the beef. I do got a lot of the broccoli. The Kung Pao chicken is better. At least 50 to 50 meat and veggies. The mushroom chicken meat is less veggies is more. All dish has a lot of sauce. Which mean the chef wok a little less and has a lot of water sauce. 

Overall experience is good. The online order need to be pick up in the store instead of drive throu

His bakery cafe and sandwich store is local favorite. We were in the area and try something for my book mark. The interesting item will be the the Tomato pie. But we did not go for it. 

We have the carrot cake. The cake is moist and good. I would said they have good dessert. It includes the banana cream pie, red velvet cake and more. There are some good sandwiches post by other including the Cuban sandwich. May be you want to try it. 

Overall is I good. I would call it average.

Basically is a take out restaurant with computer order. There were a few tables to sit. No restroom facilities, only bottles water. It is designed for take out. Menu easy to read. Very simple. 

We got the beef kimbap. This is like sushi roll with bulgogi beef. It has, egg, pickle veggies. Consider this is a large roll. We also got the spicy pork lunch box. It has fried pork dumplings, kimchi, rice and spicy pork. Food is good to have. For take out, they are good. For dine in probably need to consider the situation.

It is about 3.5 stars restaurant. Being at downtown Tampa, it should be busy.  We were there at Friday around 11:30, this place only 35% fill. These should be easy for them to serve us. By the time we walk out at 12:15 pm. The place is full. 

The lunch special is attractive. I saw the chicken chimichurri hash at lunch special menu is attractive. The dish serve in skillet with potatoes hash, grilled chicken, grilled onion and top with two egg of your choice. Sunny side up is definitely the best to break the egg yolk for the mixed of the hash. This dish also has the chimichurri sauce make this dish decorative. 

For the energy, I have morning meditation drink. It is orange, lemon, turmeric, ginger, agave nectar, and beet. What a drink and nice presentation. 

Service is a little let down at the end.  Food is good.

It was great that I revisit the restaurant since we have a bad experience in the first time. A lot of things have been changed. We were here after late night movie. 

A lot of improvement has been made. Food come out a lot faster. The noodle was prepared correctly not glue together. I have order the devil spicy ramen. It is spicy not super spicy. The soup is still salty. The egg need a bit work - over cook. The noodle need some sesame oil to make flavor better. 

Overall is good. It is big improvement.

It is a fast food joint. Order and paid at counter. Nothing fancy. Just like mall food. Except more personal touch with cooking after order. Seem like fried rice and noodle being pre-cook for assembly. 

I hope for Bento to be here at Bay Area and now they are here which has not impress me. The best thing about this place is their bento box with many items and reasonable price. I would come back lack of time to eat but not for date night. 

We got the Korean beef and the Katsu bento box. The Korean beef did not fare well. But the katsu is good. The string beans has no salt in the bento box. We also got the spicy tuna small with 4 pieces. This item is a bit expensive. However, it has good flavor. 

We got the boba tea which is fun to have. Something I don't understand is when you paid and order at counter, the alway have a tip box to check for 18% to 20%. The only service is bring the food on table. That always doesn't make sense for cafeteria type food service industry.

Mi Bandera has been in my bookmark for sometime been want to try it. This was the second Columbian restaurant of the week. They definitely a solid 3 stars and above average. 

Typical Columbian restaurant. I always like Columbian candy they give at the bill. Each restaurant has different candy so do this restaurant. We have the tripe soup, black sausage, churrasco Bandeja paisa. The tripe soup is ok. The churrasco is good flavor, the pork belly do not has salt, the sausage is average, it does give a good portion of food for good price. My wife want to try the black sausage which is blood sausage. It can be better with correct seasoning. 

Our experience here is good. Nothing stand out but solid. The server know a bit English and enough to take your order. Even change the TV channel for you. Overall many Latin people eat there. Many have look at us and curious what we have order. They were surprised we know our order :)

Ha ya- karate chop. No it just the tea. It has some kick in it. No hand chop:) 

Kung fu mean martial art in Chinese. When they use together with food mean their specialty food. I have been to this place 4 times and gather my conclusion of this place. The tea place is upscale. Nice sofa and seat. They have the regular tea mix. You can add toppings of your choice that is when they get you with up charge. The have good enough tea taste. Other than that. They have a lot of toppings or inclusion selection. 

I have the pina colada with mango jelly. Not bad at all. We were here 35 minutes before it closed and we drink to the last minute. This will be the eat around 4th stops. We enjoy our moment with friend here.

Neighborhood Taco Bell for drink and snack. I have never use their food for meal. But I do like their select item over Mc Donald for snack. 

I here mainly for the happiest hour soft drink. During 2pm to 5pm each day, the drink is a dollar. I usually get the Baja blast freeze. They do have other choice like the pomegranate water, other flavor of freeze. Taco Bell generally is healthy choice than Mc Donald in the fast food chain. I remember an old futuristic movie "Demolition Man" shows the only surviving franchise in the future is Taco Bell. The movie shows the people with healthy living and change society and the Taco Bell is the high class restaurant. Imagine that is all we eat in the future???

I also like their snack for the crunchy taco or the steak quesadilla. Love the steak quesadilla here. If they can only using just the Swiss cheese, I will know at their door often.

The Domina's pizza is actually located inside the gas station. I am not much a pizza lover, but if I have to chose the pizza chain domina is my choice. I like old thick crust pizza, I am not a fan of tin crust. If you have to pig out, please go all out with no reservation. At that point you have blown the calories count any how. 

Tonight they have the $5 two topping deal large pizza. It is enough for me and my wife. We have order the pepperoni and bacon. I call in 10 minutes before my pickup and they are ready on time. The two topping deal only on the carry out. Please make a trip to nearby pizza place. The total come to $6. Great value. 

They lay the pepperoni then the bacon on top. The pepperoni is great and crispy. With bacon on top the juice of bacon further cook the pepperoni to give extra crispy. The bacon is great in this sense. Everything go well with bacon. 

Please catch the deal while they last.

3.5 stars restaurant to my book. This new Rice Bean has been building their new hop for long time. Finally it opened for business. It does bring crowd in from the area. There are not much good mom and pop restaurant in the area to compete. They are really located at good spot for business. 

We got the Churrasco and Bistec Empanado. The churrasco is the skirt steak. Their skirt steak cut like a strip with about 1" diameter and 7" long. I prefer to thin and at Falda cut which they don't carry. The marinated sauce is good. The steak is cook to medium not like my order medium rare. Overall is a good dish. The Bistec Empanado is breaded thin steak. The breaded coating has no taste. I have been many Latin restaurant have better coating than them. 

One other thing. We walk into the restaurant and there was no line on Tuesday night. The hostess still saying we have to wait for ten minutes for table. I see there is open table. At the end we choose the bar instead of waiting. Service is not attentive. Many area of the restaurant need to improve. Service, hostess, food.

I like our food here but not necessary we have best time. First the wait, the hostess tell us 10-15 minutes. It turn up another ten minutes. I walk around and found empty tables but they are not occupied by anyone. I went to check when is our turn, they lead me to the same empty table that I found 5 minutes ago. The seat is just below the AC vent. I can feel the drip of the water. They definitely need to check this vent on their off hour. Make sure water molecules is contained. 

The only thing I like about this place is the service on the table and the food. Which is the most important. My wife has the Thai Coconut-Lime Chicken. It a bit lime heavy at the end. The best is the Hibachi Steak. It is the hunger steak with shiitake mushrooms in slice, caramel onion and sprout. It also included the wasabi mash potatoes and tempura asparagus. This steak is cook with the ginger sauce which is a good match. 

Service is good over the dining time. Food come out the right time compare to my last visit. I would said the hostess need to paid attention to the empty table. Customers is less patient when exceed to the wait acknowledge time. The AC vent need to be clean and make not dripping water. Who know what dust has the water has collected.

Columbian restaurant that open not long ago. It was on the neighborhood paper. Decided to give them a try. At the front of the store, they display the Latin pastry and finger food and chicharon. It was beautifully displayed. We got some of their pastry. The pastry is definitely 5 stars item. I would love to buy their pastry again. Pastry are delicious. Love it. 

For the entrees, we have the Carne A la Plancha. It single grilled steak. The other dish is the grilled skirt steak. I would said they are not the expert of the steak. The control of the steak temperature or marinated sauce is not there. The technique is average. 

Service is good. Food come out quick. The table and seating is basic set in the restaurant. They have a few booth you can have more privacy.

Fast food in restaurant setting. 

The restaurant is big with a lot of seating. When it was just open, it is almost like the attraction of the Brandon. It has nice deco in the interior. It still busy even now. Now is not like pack crazy. 

I am just wants to get the experience of it. We have the fried halibut, grilled tuna sandwich and chocolate cake. The halibut do not impress me. It is a small sandwich compare to Burger King or McDonald fish sandwich. The grilled tuna is excellent with taste. The chocolate cake that day is not moist but it has the softness and good mix of cake. 

Overall, they are average. They do have a lot help on kitchen. However, the food still take 10 minutes. Compare to many fast food, they are considered slow to deliver.

No many Krispy Kreme left in Tampa Bay Area. Definitely not many hot now doughnuts store. I love hot now sign because it is just make it. The doughnut is fresh out from kitchen. The Dough is still warm and the sugar glaze just harden. Krispy Kreme offer that in their doughnut store. 

I am here for their special coupon for a dozen glaze donuts for $5. Only the email sign up user have that coupon. It is good deal. I got the hot now freshly made donuts. It was so yummy and I have to open my box and eat them immediately. It definitely allows me to go for second donut after I have finished the first one. 

This location is my first visit. I think the wait can be shortened since there is not many customers during 3 pm.

This sandwich is a historic sandwich store. Many my friends gave god review here. As a result, I have bookmarked this place 4 years ago. I am happy to be here. 

I have the Cuban sandwich. It was great the sandwich was prepared very fast. I do ask the sandwich to be toasted. After first bite, I think the whole sandwich is sour compared to most of the Cuban sandwich I have. I think the pickle was put there with the pickle sauce was dip into it. The sandwich did not has the mojo pork. Not sure which version of Cuban sandwich is this. I would is Americano sandwich not Cuban.

I was here Thursday night. The place have good crowd considering it located in community plaza. The bar area is empty and since I am eating a lone, might as well have the bar and watch football game. 

They have the free lime margarita with purchased a meal. So I go for the free margaritas. Unfortunately they don't have margaritas. Since when a Mexican restaurant doesn't serve margaritas. May be only the food truck. 

I got the seafood fajitas. Seem like the picture in yelp show this dish very intriguing. It has scallops, shrimp, mussels, crab meat and fish. This is the first time I have fajitas with crab meat. Very interesting. I actually like this dish. I like the seafood over caramelized onion. The taste is good. I like the fried bean and rice come with it. Except the salsa is too little. Food is 4 Stars. 

The service is average. Waiters are arguing who to help. It will be ok for the common good. Food come out quick enough. The chip on the pre-meal smell like fried in the old oil pot.

The Tampa Bay has an explosion on the poke restaurant. This poke is kind of close to town and country area. I like that most of the restaurant spread out the Tampa Bay Area. I like the building has high ceilings but. 

Here you can have their preset menu with ingredients and sauce arranged or build your own. I got my base as sushi rice. I also got all ingredients except onion and edamame. I also added an add on seaweed salad dressing addition scoop of protein. It turn the add on and tax is close $15. It is at high side for poke. A assembly food is a bit high. 

I would they are in the middle of the pack for poke. Reason below. Many place offer multi scoop proteins. Many of the added on is part of the deal with no additional cost. Some other place even mix the sauce, protein and ingredients before putting in the bowl. This extra step will help instead of putting the sauce drizzle on the top.

It is 3.5 stars restaurant. I am here to get the drink after exercise. I like boba so I check the are who has boba. This store is famous on poke. Not sure boba also good or not. I give them a try. I got the coffee slush. The slush is kind of watery. The boba is not the chewy type boba more like the jello. Also the boba has not flavor. One good thing is they have good coffee mixed in it. 

For boba they are average. But I saw customers in front of me got the poke which has good mixed up. It look delicious. May be poke is the only thing to go here

My friend like Green Lemon for Tuesday Taco. I can see this is a hip place due to the atmosphere of the place. Many young people love this because affordable food with booze. 

There are few things that the restaurant is just an average. Number one is wait for table. Number two is wait for the food. Number three is very tire server. Number four is in experience hostess. All this actually give them 2.5 stars. Wait for table is 45 minutes, wait for the food after order is 25 minutes, waitress is beat up and tired. Not sure how many table they have to take care. Hostess tell you 30 to 45 minutes wait is definitely 45 minutes. They need to clean up the table sooner and allow to clear the queue wait line. Since you have to wait for the food, it make wait line longer. 

One thing they can improve dramatically is make sure each order come out quickly which will reduce the wait. It definitely effects the tip because of the wait and cause the waitress look tired and not happy. Kitchen crew definitely need to come out the food more efficient. Mexican food should be easy assembly and able to deliver quickly.

This an average Roll ice cream store. I have better on other places. With that said. I have to give them credit on the only one in New Tampa right now which we don't need to drive too far to have one. 

This is only base in the roll ice cream. They have many item such crepe choco Coro new item and Acai. This items was not reviewed. Base on their roll ice cream, the selection is good. But the toppings is little. The charge is high. 

We have the on snow in the assembly menu. The toppings are chocolate roll cookies and top with coconut flakes. The ice cream is creamy than other roll ice cream. Which is a good thing. I only don't like the pricing and so little toppings. Overall experience is good. I would give them at average among the same business. However, I do want to try their crepe. It look interesting.

I have been eating their food very often. However, I have never review them. Our company lunch meeting often order from this place. Some time is good and some time is off. This is about 3.5 star restaurant in my book. 

Today I have the calamari and Tazza Istanbul Shrimp. I have order the appetizer of the calamari is for me to chew while keep me awake during the lunch seminar. It is working. Although it is not the best fried calamari, but it didn't cost that much either. The Tazza Istanbul Shrimp have a good Turkish sauce to go with it. It accompanied well within the rice. The shrimp size is about 36 count per pound. It is not the big size. Food is ok. 

They offer very complete menu and many choices. Start with appetizer, salad, soup, sandwich, wrap, seafood, platter, burger, and their specialty.

This Thai place is local favorite. A lot of take out. Not many dine in customer. The wait for take out is 20 minutes. We also got the take out. This restaurant is located on last corner building plaza. 

We got the Cashew Nut chicken. The sauce and ingredients is there. Good wok technique. We also got the Penang curry pork. Sauce is good. Ok curry. The only thing I would said is the quantity is small compared to many Thai restaurants. I would not suggest this restaurant if you really hungry.  

Overall is the food is ok. Just average restaurant among the Thai restaurants I have visited.

My Malaysian friend has told me about this restaurant about the Malaysian food is modify to American version. I have to confirm how close they are on their cuisine. It take me one year to reach this place since I have book mark it. 

I have opportunity to travel to this area for my vehicle maintenance and decided to try them out. We have the beef rendang, chicken stay, and fried Koay Teow. The rendang gulai need a bit sauce. It need to be a bit wet conditions sauce. The yellow ginger is good but need to be a bit heavy spice. The stay is not close. It not close the Malay satay or Penang satay. The satay need a bit sweet. 

The Koay Teow is the best dish but compare to the street vendor in Malaysia, the is a lot room to improve. I agree with my friend their Malaysian food is American in style. It is made to the local favorite but not Malaysian liking. This is a been there done that deal for me.

The dessert look Paris item but not for the Banh Mi. The restaurant look nice and bright lay out. Social distancing is observed. One thing I like most is their pate chaud. This item look like Cuban pastry but with oriental seasoning meat in fill. It is delicious. The pastry crust also very good. I recommend this dish. 

The drink is good because they give close 20 drink. Price wise is about $.50 cheaper than most. I got the coconut slush with grass jelly. The grass jelly was did a good job. Soft and jelly. 

The banh mi is below average. The bun was to tough to bite. I think it need to be toasted for easy bite. Seem like the bun was sit there some time. We got the special combination banh mi and grilled pork banh mi. One compliment can give is the grey paste did a good job. The meat for special and grilled pork are just average.

We were stop here before the the Yelp CMYE. Since the CYME will only have snack and we decided to eat here. There is a lot customer in and out here I hope it will be good. Unfortunately, there is no fireworks for this pho place. 

I order the Pho Viet Northern Combination. The server brought out the soup but he insists the soup is not our table while we should be the next group to get the noodle soup. He could not find the order is belong to us and he set our soup noodle in the empty table. The manager then verified and brought the soup at our table. Very confusing. By this time our rare beef in the soup is cook through. The soup is in the sweet side. The shrimp is fresh and bouncy. 

Because they are not located in the pho hub, they have no competition. They can survive the business because far away from the hub. It would not be able to survive if it is located at the Dale Mabry or Pinellas Pho hub. The soup is average. Not the top notch. I could have given them two star because they mixed up the order.

Friday night happy hour at 5:30 is good. Easy to get a sit without reservation. However, one thing you need to know Friday night happy hour has a lot of people visit this place. Even they have eight sushi chef, it will take 30 minutes to deliver the food from order. So if you are in hurry, Friday happy hour may not be a good ideal. 

The restaurant certainly a big step out from the old location. The open space concept and decorations is definitely a 5 stars rating. Out seating has small waterfall and fire place create many good atmosphere. They also has a private room for 20 people that is well decorated. 

Food on happy hour may not speak the same language. Although they are good value but the taste is just not measured up. Only the gators roll and eel roll measure up. The rest of the roll taste the same. Good sushi grade fish. I would go for the nigiri or sashimi. I think they are still rushing on the roll preparation.

This mall provide shelter for hot weather in Florida. It was great to walk under roof with cover and climate control area. This mall has typical store and not so typical stores. The typical stores include the Old Navy, H&M, Victoria Secret, Rue 21, and more. 

But I am more interested on the not so typical store such as Play Live Station, SP Shoe Palace, Spencer Gift, Naples Soap Company, Torrid, Atomic Tattoo. These store are the fun part of the mall. Play Live Station is cool set up with black light set up. The Spencer Gift has some unique gift item that is interesting to visit. Torrid is a plus size dress that look good on the plus size women. 

This mall is still enlarging to include dick sporting good, pet store and more. Movie theater is at different building that not connected. Food has some selection on the food court. There are some restaurant chain located here.

I would said this is an old folks restaurant. The reason I said it because of the way they cook the food. Mostly broil and less sodium. It is an Greek restaurant with many history in Bay Area. 

They an not advertised rack of lamb. Only ask and you shall have it. It is not in the menu. We did not go for it since we are getting the early bird special. We have the broil octopus and the broil dole fish. The octopus is not grilled. If the grilled it will be much better. It is serve with sour sauce. The sole fish is only broil with stir fry veggies. I think all dish lack of salt or seasoning. Great for senior people. 

Service is good at restaurant. May be the happy hour is less people.

Cool place with outdoor seating and some game board for customers. A lot customers come here for burger because so far there was not a burger place is decent enough except this one at this area. This place is good after sun is set and the weather is better with cooler conditions. 

I have the shroom burger. This is a marinated burger patty. It has some spice in it. I think their patty is cook through. Meat is good with marinated. Mushroom on top was sautéed. Good flavor. The mushroom is the best part of the burger. Fried is normal. The bun is good. 

Judging the price to the food value, this is 3.5 stars. Patty can be bigger. The burger is expansive for food truck and outdoor seating. For the amount of money many, we are expecting more from the food.

It is about 3.5 stars for this restaurant. The best thing is their rib and the good combo plate price. May be when I visit is late before they are closing, the meat just average. I would said this is a neighborhood restaurant. 

We got two combo of three items for $16 each. The price is fair for dinner. My plate is the sausage, rib, and the brisket. My two side is the baked bean and parsley potatoes. The meat is just average. The rib is the best. I like side parley potatoes. Other plates is with rib, chop pork and chicken. All item is just average. The meat is more to original taste. They encourage you to use the BBQ sauce with the meat. 

Services are good. We were able to finish at 40 minutes. The lunch special is worth for a visit. If you like BBQ. This is good option.

I have been to this Starbucks several time. But each time they just give me a so so impression. The reason behind is every time I am there the trash can is full, the table is dirty, the floor is not up to the standard. Seem like is a management problem. They need to tidy the store. I always seen a lot of them employees but did not see they actually care or clean the store. 

The shaken tea with pineapple black tea is refreshing. It is better and cheaper than their coffee. They do have other drink like infusion lemonade and chai tea latte. They also has strawberry acai. I thinks they are branch out from just coffee.

The restaurant open for sit down during pandemic. But I see a lot of take out on the take out table. I also got take out. The restaurant has patio seating since they are at the corner of the building. 

We got the garlic pepper squid and Siam noodle. The garlic squid did cook the Thai hot that I was asking. It has good sauce. But the squid feel like previous frozen food and defrost and cook. The quality is not quite there. I also feel their wok technique is not there too. May be is off day. The Siam noodle is a bit better. However the noodle seem like not cook to high BTU burn edge. If the noodle done that way, I can do it at home. 

This is about 2.5 stars restaurant. The items they can improve is improve their overnight food frozen technique and longer wok time to get the high BTU effect. My order was on time to pick up and they are ready.

This seafood market and restaurant is a interesting combination. You actually can buy the raw seafood there and cook it yourself. You also can ask them to cook it for you. This option combination is great for the customers. 

The Seafood Select cook shrimp by pound, by number of shrimp or by their combination platter. It is convenient. Some time you feel like eating by the number of shrimp. 15 mid size shrimp for $7 is good deal. You also can get combination as a meal deal. The have fried or scampi. Their fried shrimp include powder spice over the fried shrimp. The only thing to improve is butterfly the shrimp and fried. 

I also got fried scallops there. Their scallops is bigger than bay scallops. I also notice they has fried crab. I also think the have peel shrimp. So go check them out yourself.

I have been to La Teresita  Restaurant several time. This restaurant is a Cuban charm in Bay Area. You can be restaurant or cafe side. The also has the bakery and cafe next to it for overflow. 

Food here is affordable. You can enjoy a steak for less than ten dollars. The serving speed is fast and you don't have to wait long and the food is ready. We have the steak Palomilla Steak and the Thursday special Pescado a la Marinera. They give you a big piece of grill steak. If you ask medium rare, they usually mid well because this steak is thin. 

The Pescado a la Marinera is grilled fish in tomato sauce with little shrimp and veggies. Fish is good. Come with two choices of side. 

Food here is reasonable but taste is just average among the Hispanic restaurant. If you like budget and fast, this will be your place.

This food truck caught our attention due to Puerto Rican cuisine. They have some interesting selection. They have some thing that nobody has it it's called trifongo. It is a combination of three different types of plantain smash together. I am highly recommend it to try this trifongo. 

Overall the menu includes shrimp, octopus, steak, chicken. If you'd like to have the combinations I would suggest try the matador. We got the trifongo, pulpo octopus, and the plantain steak sandwich. The plantain steak sandwich is excellent. This sandwich wrap with plantain skin. The steak is well prepared. The octopus also very good. Unfortunately I have a piece of bad octopus and cause my stomach ache. The trifongo is delicious. 

This food truck definitely is about 4.5 stars. Unfortunately I cannot give them that due to one bad octopus. However, I am still recommending this food truck for the unique food experience. Especially the killer frape that they serve.

This restaurant use to be Lee Roy Selmon BBQ. Now it is Glory Days. It is sport bar. I was surprised that not many watch the opening ceremony of the Olympic in this bar. 

I have call ahead for a pickup food. I got the 12 pieces dry chicken wings. It accompanied the tangy  buffalo sauce. These wings is seasoning and drizzle with spice. The wing is not bad but do not have wow factor. It is about $1.10 per wing. Average in pricing. However it come with celery and ranch sauce. It has some value in it. 

The take out should be on time when you call and you got the pick up time. They told the food should be ready in 20 to 25 minutes. And I show up at 30 minutes and still have to wait for another 13 minutes. This need to improve for the take out process.

I have been to Mise en Place pass three time. I have not write a review because I was not a Yelp member then. For the pass three time, I enjoy the food there but there was long time ago. 

Now I have revisited this place after our light party at HCC. As a result, I decided not going with the main dish. So I have two appetizers small dishes. I have the pork belly and the fried quail. Before the dish come out, there was a complimentary dish with crab meat with sauce at bottom. This is truly a good dish. The seared pork bell came out fist. Since this is first course, I think it should be quickly. But it take some time. Fortunately we already have food at elsewhere. The dish came out and the chef is clever to separate the skin from the pork belly. The skin is deep fried and the remaining is seared. It taste like Chinese crispy pork. Not impress. The bean olive oil purée is good. 

The second dish is fried quail. This dish is disappointed. The quail is deep fried. But the batter is tasteless. I have to use the salt and pepper to make it more flavor. It serve over the waffle and some ketchup like sauce. 

The service is ok. I think it can be a bit faster. The food delivery need to way more faster. Not sure will be back.

This Cuban restaurant close to Apollo Beach is one of the high ratings restaurant in the area. We like to check out if it live the rating as many Yelpers have posted. It was interesting to see so many businesses in this area once I drove off the I-75. 

We have order the baby churrasco and the Cuban wannabe. The churrasco may be need a bit less lemon or no lemon. Let the customers added by themselves. I ask for medium rare, it comes medium. Meat quality is average. 

My friend Cuban sandwich or Cuban wannabe is very good. Crispy and tasty. Sandwich here is good. 

Service is ok. But the water cup is empty never refill. This area can be worked on. Price for lunch is reasonable medium range. Table may need to be replaced. Close out is good. Since one good dish and one below average dish with below level service is about 3 star. Average.

I has been want to try this chain for some time. This is Greek and seafood place. I was in hurry and saw them on the street. I have checked them out on the Yelp and feel it is good for a try. 

The food order is delivered at average wait time since I ask my fish to be grilled. I have order seafood platter special. It come with choice fried or grilled on shrimp and fish. I have selected the fish grilled and fried shrimp. It come with French fries. The fish is not open flame grilled, it is cook over the hot plate. It does have good flavor. The fried shrimps have spice in the coating. It is pleasant to eat. Although they are not as seafood market fresh, but they are good enough. 

The platter come with drink for $10.99. Average deal. It is quick and easy to dine in the restaurant.

Casa Mexicana = Supertaco. 

Supertaco is actually part of the restaurant - Casa   Mexicana. I was there at 6:00 pm and they get all the ingredients to their taco truck. I just don't understand why they park their truck outside of the restaurant and sale the same type of taco. In fact the restaurant taco is $1.75 and the truck is $2.50 per taco. Guess what, I choose over roof with air condition in the restaurant. It come with free chip before the food come. 

The taco is good. I like the carne Asada. The pastor has piece of grill pineapple on the top is the best taco. 

Overall they are good, I like they have the salsa on the all you can take corner to load your taco. The have music jewel box for the selected music. Seem like they may have the dance party if they clear the table in the middle.

We were near the St. Pete downtown and my colleagues suggest the red Mesa for lunch. I was here before and I was having dinner last time. This is the first time I having lunch. 

The location is convenient for the downtown St. Pete. They have the outside and inside sitting area. Today is heavy pollen time with the oaks tree is blooming, sitting out is not a good idea. The setting is very modern. It may be a good place lunch bite get on the way to work. The food came out quick for this restaurant during lunch time. 

I have order three taco. The duck, steak, and ahi tuna taco. The ahi tuna is seared and mix with green, wasabi and soy sauce. I feel that the tuna is not well season. They did not seared long enough to allow fish burn taste. The steak taco is mixed with Rajas and jack cheese. I am not a fan. The duck taco duck is orange duck. By adding the goat cheese, it destroys the beauty taste of the duck orange sauce. Sometime thing should not mixed together and this one of the example. 

Acoustic guitar live music was performed here. Overall the serving is great and the food came out fast make they deserve 3 star.

The location of the restaurant as part of the city water park make the unique setting. The backdrop sunset can be better to tell the story of restaurant. 

We arrive at the restaurant at Sunday night 5:50 pm and the wait line is already require 50 minutes of wait. We decide to sit at the oyster bar and have our dinner. The menu is interesting. To start we have the pulpo carpaccio - shave octopus with spicy source. While we were sitting there, there are worker open the oyster. After we have finish the octopus while waiting for the entree, we decided to order the oyster. I ask the worker can we select the oyster for the charbroil. They allow me to select. I have select the bigger and nicer oyster and the send to the kitchen to cook. 

The oyster is definitely the best dish of the appetizer. For the entree we have order the Florida Pompano and the Chief red Eagle Duck. The duck is ok and they try to imitate the French cuisine Duck O' lean. The pompano is tasty however the fish is not salty enough. I believe they can be better. For our entree we have wait for 30 minutes after the appetizer was finish. The time to wait is too long. 

Our fellow elite yelp member is overrated this restaurant. The price range is expensive but the food is  mediocre. The only dish that impress me is the charbroil oyster. If you notice, half of the entree menu items are open grill cooking not stir fry or pan sear. This tell you the skill of the chef and their capability.

This Wawa has is not the cheapest in the area. The gas station is clean. During my visit, many has visited this place. It has plenty gas pump to handle the rush traffic hour. They have free air to the vehicle tires. However, it is cover for out of service. Not sure when will it back.

I have this restaurant book mark for a while. Finally I found a time to visit. The restaurant tuck away in a busy plaza. Parking always challenging here. The restaurant has inside and outside seating. I went straight to the bar since I am solo that day. The bar has good display of alcohol bottles. 

The menu for the brunch hour is extensive. Selection is wide range. Base on the yelp picture, the steak and egg is popular. But one of the menu item changes my mind. I got the lobster omelette. This dish has lobster, provolone, tomato and wrapped in the egg. The side is potatoes hash. The lobster is three little lobster crawl. I wish it has some body meat for the price we paid. 

The service is good. Food come out quick. But the food didn't sit well with the stomach. Something not quite correct about the freshness.

This restaurant has high ratings. However, I found that not match the experience I have there. I visited the restaurant after 8 pm. Still have table waiting for food and some people order the take out. Not too busy. 

I have order the spicy drunken noodles with shrimp. I have specific order. I want my noodles dry which mean don't let the juice come out. I also order it to be Thai spicy hot. While I wait for the food, they do have special day combination or pre prix dish on holiday. Look interesting. 

When my noodles come out, there are wet sauce every where. Which mean it was not on the wok too long. Because no burn mark at the noodles. The dish is medium spicy. Not even close one step below Thai hot. This too difficult to fixed. One good thing is they have good size fresh shrimp. I didn't ask for redone due to time. 

This is been there done that.

This new Indian cuisine is located in the heart of Carrollwood. If you find Chili's, they are just next to it. They offer weekday lunch buffet for about $10 and weekend buffet $13. There is a lot Indian customers dine there when we were there. 

We were there for the weekend buffet. It has good selection. If you are meat eaters, there will s a lot of choices. During the Saturday lunch buffet, they have goat, chicken and shrimp. The goat curry is fantastic. The tandoori chicken is marinated to the bone. It is quite tasty. The tempura shrimp may be with tikka sauce ( not sure ) is good. 

Why three stars. A lot of improvement need to be made. 1. Services need to paid attention when customers water is empty. 2. Temperature of the food is at warm condition not temperature hot. 3. The food is too American. Not spicy enough. May be the spice need to improve a bit to make it stronger.

Close to 3.5 stars restaurant. I applaud their good price for people who craving for sushi. Although they may not the best, but judging for the affordable, I will give them a repeat visit which most of the owner is asking for. A repeat customer. 

This is close to cafeteria style with order at the counter and bring the food to the table. Their regular sushi is under $5. Specialty sushi is about $9. They have hibachi for your order. 

I have order the appetizer as fried rock shrimp. This is good size of shrimp. Each piece is about a dollar. Our main entrées are the stir fry beef noodle, spicy tuna, volcano roll, and Hawaii roll. Spicy tuna roll stands out for the taste. Good flavor. The specialty roll are drop behind the good name. 

I would try their lunch special if I am here. Better than fast food chain for the same amount of money.

The food here is cheaper than many Americans fast food. If you are going spend money in the McDonald might as well to check it out for the better choice other than Hamburger. For the same price you can get a meal for less than $8. 

This is my first visit for the restaurant at the mall. I have visited many Panda Express at the Airport food court. Time to time they have the new product. Today they have the Peking Pork. It is boneless pork cover in Peking sauce after deep fried. It is delicious. The noodle may be need some work to make it less drier and boil it longer. 

I like Strings beans with beef. Overall this good value. It has all the nutritional need. If you are hungry, you can choose more protein. The price just slightly expensive for you hungry stomach. Service is good.

Grocery store??????? A pizza and beer restaurant is more like it. The name of the restaurant is base on historic grocery store was here. It do has some craft beer. 

The pizza we order tonight is bring the noise. It has all kind of meat items such as bacon, pepperoni, sausages, meatballs, ham. The smaller pizza is 16" is good for 4 people. It also has fresh veggies ingredients to go with it. They claim the pizza is stone bake and suppose to be healthy pizza. We also add a bake chicken wings without the hot sauce. It has herb on top but is salt less. 

This restaurant is about 3.5 stars for the food and performance. A few thing can be improved such as take home box should not be single plying cardboard. It should be pizza box. Because the oil of the pizza will sip below the box and oil your car seat. Weekend may need more help since many show up at the restaurant.

Chuy is new Tex Mex in the Wesley Chapel. They have the new building that design into their requested ambient. The interior decoration includes the Elvis 60 style set up. The space is beautiful. It is comfortable. 

One best thing about this place is the price and food quantity. This I no doubt the generous restaurant we have seen in Wesley Chapel. A lot of items have good value. 

For the taste is what they need to improve on. I feel they lack of taste. We got the steak fajitas. It come with 3 flour taco. It has guacamole, cheese, salsa, sour cream, rice, and caramel onion. The second dish is the combo special with taco and green enchilada. 

Service is average. Food come out to the table on time. I did not try the drink. We don't need to wait for the table when we get to the restaurant.

Dickey BBQ is middle of the pack among the BBQ joints. If you have coupons, the deal is very sweet. Dickey grill and smoke the meat. It has different meat to offer. The best are the pull pork and brisket. 

You can order plate (combination meat), sandwich, meat by 1/2 pound. The plate has good deal and you can choose two or three meat plate. It come with drink, two side and the price close to $12. You also can enjoy the soft serve for free. We got the burn end brisket and pull Pork. It was very good the day we have visited them. They were going to throw away the side fat and o ask them just put in my plate. 

The BBQ franchise was established since 1941. This restaurant is young at Wesley Chapel. This was our third visit and it still good. I think they need to increase number employees since this area is just lack off.

This is second Mellow Mushroom we have been to. Basically is pizza, calzone, burger, wing, and salad place. Really is nothing fancy. In compare to some of the wood fire pizza at nearby restaurant is just average. 

We got their house special pizza. The meat is nothing special. The crust is too thick. We also got their wing.  But there are better wing place nearby. It is oven roasted. But the marinated is not impressive. House salad is good. 

Service is better. May be this is only good thing about the restaurant.

We were so happy to revisit the ramen place I like. I was look forward to try the seafood ramen and crispy duck ramen. The seat was easy and quick since they are not busy. Our food come out right time without too much of waiting. The food are presentable. All this are good. 

Two minutes into the food we immediately find the noodle is not right. Some of the noodle are glued together. Seem like 5 Strings becomes one string. My wife noodle is very gooey. This is not acceptable. I think my noodle was sit for a while and my wife noodle was not processed correctly. In Asia, the noodle need to be broil and put in the cold water to cool off and the same time wash away the extra flour that attached to avoid gooey. This is the basic. I think their chef has not pay attention to our bowl and skip step. That cause the entire noodle are not good at all. If this happens in Asia, they will not be acceptable. 

I think with each bowl we paid $16 a piece. It is not to any standard and not to the art of ramen. Not worth the money. Inconsistency does cause this restaurant to be changed my opinion of number one ramen in the Bay Area to I am not sure to revisit again. I have drove 38 mile just because I have the best experience on the first encounter. Now, I am not sure their future.

The food deliver safety for the restaurant is an A grade. They have you order online and pay online without touching. The pickup also touch less because you roll down window of the passenger side for them to drop the food. The check in also touch less by said that you are here to pickup. 

The Carside pickup simply doesn't work. I have put my order in the restaurant at 1pm for 4:40pm pickup. I arrive and check in at 4:39. I was assigned a parking spot for pickup to wait for them to take the food to deliver to the car. I was wait there till 5:07 pm for deliver the food to my car. 28 minutes wait at partial shade area. Some car doesn't even have shade area. For taking so long to wait for the food I thought they must be cook the food when you check in. It was not. It is warm food and seem like seating at the kitchen. Obviously the my early put in order was cook on time but the communication from check in to food delivery to car was not coordinated. I also see an customer who missing a sauce and they take about 10 minutes to get the missing sauce to him. The execution is a F. 

With that said. Their grade could be D. But I give them C because the food still tasty.

Caffeine is an Internet cafe. Many of the customers hang out there with computer. May be school homework to work as group.

The cafe is comfortable. It has a nice set up. They serve some interesting signature ice coffee. I got the Ice Caramel Delite. It is $4.5 for about 12 oz. for ice coffee that size is considered on the high side for the price. Most ice coffee serve in 16 oz due to ice was added at 70% of entire cup. With 12 oz. you will have less coffee in it. 5 big sip and all gone. 

The coffee is good taste. Especially the caramel in it at the bottom. It interesting to have that. The coffee is very concentrated which after the ice melt, I still like to drink on it.

Average among the Kung Fu tea chain restaurant Bay Area plus Sarasota for the food. It is about 3.5 stars. Drink may be ok. I like the new space of the Kung Fu tea. Somehow this supposed to be open at Belcher and Ulmerton but take year to change to this location. 

I got the ninja chicken to go. The box is half box with lettuce at the bottom. Quantity is only 13 pieces of chicken. Coating is not the best. No five spice seasoning. Chicken feel like processing meat. Not sure any good thing about the ninja chicken. Price for that many pieces is pricey.

I was here to try their new items. KFC now have a lot different types of buckets deal. But I am here for their combo meal. I got their two pieces dark meat original fried chicken. The combo meal come with one side and drink. I still like their potatoes with gravy side item. 

I have try their new product- Nashville Hot Chicken Strips. The Nashville hot is good hot. Chicken strips are crispy. I would love to have this dish. The last dish is the popcorn chicken nuggets box. This $10 deal is good for movie night. The chicken get bigger pieces than old popcorn chicken. It is a improvement. 

During the pandemic, the drive through is one window with person handle the money and the food is one person. I think this is the area to improve. No mask is found on the person who at the drive through window

This restaurant is 3.5 stars in my book. It has the vibe of fast food concept. Food should be easy to order. Due two employees collecting money and assembling your in the evening hours, it will be a challenge if the line has 7 people. When one is assembled the phone order which mean down to one to take care of the front counter. Delay happens. 

We have the carne Asada, pastor, carnitas, grilled mahi mahi tacos. The carne Asada is the best seller. A lot of people ordered it. The beef was cut into good size of beef cube. It has quantity even thought they charge over 3 dollars for a taco. Worth the money. The fish has good grilled mark. The other two just average. Overall is not a bad deal. 

There are a lot of young people come to enjoy the dinner. I also like the guacamole with chip. It has good guacamole. The taco has unlimited toppings which make many return to revisit.

This may be the first poke spot in New Tampa Area. I am excited new business ideal to be build on the neighborhood. It is perfectly located at The Seven Oak large community entrance. It serve New Tampa and Wesley Chapel. 

After so many poke place pop out in Bay Area, this one is in the middle. Reason as below. When you decided for the protein, they determined two or three scoop. The difference is $2. However the scoop they are using is extremely small than the ice cream scoop. In addition, they scoop up the fish and press against the wall. So you got half of the scoop. Not like scoop up the meat and let it fall scoop. 

The add on is not impressive. Just like typical poke place. They premixed some of the protein like marinated tuna, spicy salmon, and spicy tuna. Ok enough selection. The sauce need to have some choice of oil base and ponzu sauce. 

Thing l like is choose any topping except avocado for $1 extra.

This is our neighborhood Olive Garden. I have been to this place many time when my kid is young. He loves the Chicken Alfredo here. This Olive Garden at New Tampa is better than the Brandon and Bush location. It provides more quantities of food than the other two locations. 

Tonight they have a promotion of 4 course meal from $14. The entree on the $14 is not attractive. As a result, my wife select the four course with Shrimp Alfredo entree $17.50. I have the rosemary garlic chicken that is not in the four course meal. The four course meal came with chicken meatball with tomato sauce. It is good. My meal came with a soup Zuppa Toscana.  I love this soup with fresh kale, Italian sausage and  slice potato. It is good when you dip your garlic bread and let it sit for a few second and allows the soup sock into the bread. Then you eat the socking bread. Yum. The rosemary garlic chicken is ok for it price. No wow factor. 

Today I am disappointed on the service. They are slow. It almost want me to give them two stars. Base on the past experience, I give them 3 stars. They could have been 4 stars, unfortunate they do not earn that tonight.

This Greenland is sister store with Greenland at Temple Terrace. I think their Temple Terrace location is better. They are very close to 3.5 stars in my book. The food is good. The decoration is basic. 

The menu is very simple. Just enough to choose from. I got kabab that day. They have three different meat to choose. Beef, lamb, and chicken. Their meat is not actually open flame grilled. It may have grilled on flat steel plate. However, the marinated flavor is there. I got the lamb and beef. The lamb is actually best and tender. The beef is a bit over cook and become tougher to bite.  I like the baba ganoush. It go well with the pita bread. The rice is too wet. Can be a bit drier. 

Overalls good value for $10.99. The food order at the counter and bring to your table. Quantity is enough for one person.

Some gourmet burger place. But I don't feel gourmet much. I think their burger just average. The burger is small. If you are big hungry man, this may not be your place. The meal deal won't be able to feed you. 

Shake Shack is a yuppie restaurant. The burger patty is press to flat and grilled to crispy. Is is different kind of burger preparation. I would definitely give them a A+ on the sauce add on especially the truffle burger. The fried onion is just a bit on their truffle burger. Overall their best burger is the truffle burger. Bacon avocado burger is ok. Definitely is a good mixture of material. 

With the size of burger and price paid, it is in the expensive side. I think they need to do something about the size of burger. Especially the new business to attract repeat customers.

A fast food joint in very nice color for the building. I have not seen a Pollo Tropical like this building color. Very Art Deco color. When you walk in the restaurant, the grilled was displayed on the side. The chicken is golden grilled. Look yummy. 

We have take from this place before. They are a bit charcoal or burn. I decided to come in here and try. We have $10 coupon for whole chicken and two sides. Very good deal. The chicken is well cook this time. The comment I have for this place is the mojo marinate is too less. The marinate only skin deep compare to other pollo tropical. It need to go to the meat. 

The service here is great and clean. Salsa can be obtained and taken at the salsa bar. I like the good deal. Order is quick. I like the color of the building.

In the Bay Area, they are average in food. But in Brandon, they do have the best German food around that area. They do get a lot of local support especially their lunch special is attractive.

We got schnitzel Berlin and schnitzel Jaeger Art. Both are fried pork with sides. The Berlin Schnitzel is come with pepper corn sauce, red cabbage, bread dumplings. But I think the Schnitzel Jaeger Art is better. It is top with creamy mushroom sauce and spaetzle. However, both breaded pork are not crispy on coating. Taste is there, I feel they are in hurry to put pork out and not fried it longer. Coating also can be improved with more tasty spices in it. 

Overall is good. Popular for lunch. Service is good.

We were here for the burger week. We did not go for the shuffle board games. The shuffle board games is ten dollars per person. They do have good indoor shuffle board facilities. The restaurant dining area has few tables for food. We sit on bar for easy service. It is almost look like dive bar. 

We got the only burger in the menu. The burger come with potato tots. The burger top with melted cheese. This burger is average. I also got the can of beer. The visit is nice. But I feel like this bar is neighborhood bar. This bar will not able to mixed complicated cocktails. They don't have mixologist. But for margaritas, they can mixed it for you. That pretty much of it.

I am trying out the jerk place I have never been too yet they are not too far from my house. This place is close to university. I have call in for my order. The pick up was no wait when I am arrived. The timing is good. 

I am determined to find out the good wings place near me. Jerk Pit provided different season spice option. The grilled wings with marinated jerk spice is interesting. Wing is about $0.85 per wing with tax. The taste is average compared to many jerk chicken around the tampa. Wing is a little bit charcoal outwardly. However the marinated spice is into the meat. 

The food is good. Delivery of the food is as promised. Solid restaurant.

Finally a short distance to drive to this BBQ joint. I remember every time I make a trip to Orlando, I have the carry out from this smokehouse BBQ restaurant. Now I can sit and eat the food at the restaurant since they open one in tampa. It Is long wait but worthies for the wait. 

Tonight (Friday night) is one of the longer restaurant hour night that they have until 9 pm. We arrive at 6:27pm and the wait line build up to sidewalk of the restaurant side. The wait on the line is 25 minute. The different of this restaurant is they built their sweet item at different side of the order line. This actually reduce the wait time compare to the one at winter park location. This is a improvement. While we were waiting on the line the server bring up the small ketchup cup size try item six shooter for the taste. 

We have order the Santa Maria Tri-Tip Steak and Smoke Prime Rib. We have added the half pound signature brisket. The side are the collar green, corn, sweet potato smash, and the bacon wrap jalapeño. The taste did not change from the original restaurant (Fairbanks Winter Park). The prime rib is juicy and tender. The brisket is well seasoning that enter to the meat it self. I love their their side because they extra effort to process it. If you fist time here, you should start with their brisket. 

If you come here to have a nice dinner, this is not the place. You should come here just for the food since your food is serve on top of paper on the tray. It is BBQ joint that you need to get down or chow down. Expecting line will build up to the door.

Just average ice cream store. Nothing special. Other than they conveniently located at Central Ave, St. Petersburg. It is easy walk distance for the downtown residents. Urban Creamery is part of URBAN local food chain. They have BBQ, southern food and deli. With ice cream add to their extended food variety that make them complete. Just need the appetizer restaurant complete the chain can offer. 

We have the rum raisin and strawberry chocolate chip. Since the 12 oz is only 2.50 more than the 6 oz, we went for the Grande. The strawberry chocolate chip is just ok. I feel they are not creamy enough. Half to the Italian ice frozen texture. The rum raisin is better. The total is close to $7 for 4 scoops is kind in the high side.

Our friend like to try shabu shabu and we pick this restaurant since they have closer one to our Chinese taste. We normally don't do shabu shabu is due to the assembly material can be obtained in any oriental market and cook it yourself. 

What is shabu shabu. My family celebrating Chinese New Year with this cuisine because it can add anyone anytime by add additional material without involving heavy cooking. The New Year also fall in the winter time and they are cold outside and shabu shabu is the best part. There is a Chinese term for shabu shabu- hot pot. We actually have the charcoal in middle to broil the soup and heat up the pot. Now we have the electric broiler that not required charcoal and easy to control the temperature of the pot. 

The material is easy. Just but the chicken and pork and remove the meat. The bone of the pork and chicken put into the soup and broil for the broth. This restaurant did not do that. All their soup is come in package of spice and added into the pot. They have the selection of the slice meat, meat or fish ball, dumpling, veggies, type noodles. They are not authentic since their soup is in package. 

Eating the hot pot is topic the sauce correctly. The right sauce is important to dip on after you have broil your material. The service of the restaurant is slow. But they have each pot for each person. Something I don't understand is why they charge the soup to broil in addition to the material. I would suggest only charge when you want to upgrade the soup.

We went back to this restaurant since my boss have a good experience last time. This time we have a different experience. Seem like the restaurant change the owner or the chef has changed. 

After the waiter took our order, the accompanying appetizer came out in different group time. We all have the same appetizer but they came out different time. Some of us have it and some have to wait. 

The garlic squid that I have order is different from I used to get. They are not as perfect garlic sauce as I know. I hope they can improve.

Mobile food truck most is some quick and easy assembling. But I have not seen a pho truck before. This is my first. 

During the Generation Food truck event for the Taste of Asia the Pho Truck was there. I have a chance to try their pho. Their pho is bit different than other Vietnamese restaurant pho. It is a bit lighter and more into cilantro taste. The price charge is typical Vietnamese restaurant pricing. It is good to have good bowl when they close to your work or venue. 

I have tried their sandwich with grilled pork, vermicelli with grilled pork and egg roll, and fresh roll. They are average. You walk to the back of the truck to see what the actions in the kitchen are. They are bunch of hard working people, two assembling food and one take order and deliver food. I would order the pho again if I see them. The line of the event for this truck is loooong. Good business when you see the line long.

After talking to my wife. I feel the pricing is in the high side.

I am ok with this place for quick bite. Grab a slice of pizza for snack or lunch. This place is busy after 8 pm. Seem like they have good business. I believe the price is affordable that drawn the crowd. 

Many choice to the type of pizzas to chose. Each slice no more than $3.50. They do have some specialty pizza that you normally not seen at pizza fast food restaurant. I would said they are better than the pizza fast food. All pizzas were made and display. You pick the one you like and ask them to heat up. Heat up is good, I prefer the freshly cook since I am in the restaurant. 

The place is popular, outside seating is available. It is fist come first seat situation. Just wait for someone the get off is easy since most people grab only a quick bite. Seat is available very soon. The problem is wait to get your table you have claim to clean up. Eventually it will be clean.

This good truck is about 3.5 stars. We were here after dinner and decided to try their food truck. Their taco has 4 selection- ground beef, chicken, pastor, and chorizo. The regular taco is $2.50. Is kind of above the average price. 

I got the chorizo and the pastor. I feel their meat is chop to fine. It feel like very powdery. However, I do like their toppings. They will ask you want a Mexican way or US way. I got the Mexican way. It top with cheese and sour cream. 

Tuesday, they have taco Tuesday for a dollar a piece. By then, it may be worth the price. Others than taco, they have quesadillas and burritos. May be that is better.

I think it is a solid four stars restaurant. Why I have three because the food did not sit well in my stomach. Other than that. They are solid 4 stars. 

Engine No 9 is visible restaurant on the MLK. They have many famous burger type including the one with crawfish tail. I did not go for their strongholds. I got their entree item with Sriracha Salmon. This dish well presented. They have good pieces of salmon steak with skin. The salmon is seared. Top with bacon and onion rings. The bed is broccoli slaw with Thai chili sauce. It is very good. The presentation of the food is top the chart. 

The service is excellent and attentive. The price for the food is reasonable. The atmosphere is bar type. I would like to try their crawfish burger next time.

A converted gas station to restaurant now is popular and hip place in Seminole Height. This restaurant is close to I-275 and easy to get to. Parking is available at the restaurant make it convenient to visit. It is a popular place for brunch and coffee. Night time it turn to gathering beer place. 

I got the Cortado to start for coffee. It is thick espresso. This type of espresso is actually origin from Spain or Portugal. Then we have BBQ pork sandwich. I think their sandwich is average. However, I like their salad that accompanied it. 

So far they have the right ideas for the hip place with garage seating and outside gas station seating. If they can add some gaming material will attract more people. Service is extremely good. Their waiter and waitress are well trained.

I was there around 4:30 pm on Sunday. The shelf for the pastry is almost empty. I bought the last guava pastry. The last pastry seem like very oily smell at my first bite. Not bad for the price just a bit over a dollar. The guava taste good. 

This place is famous on their fabulous Cuban bread. It is long mean very long bread. Many come to here just to have that. It is good value. The entire store has no ac and good to raise the yeast.

The visit was pleasant. The restaurant is located in a very nice plaza and they are kind in the center attractions of the plaza. Parking is free but the plaza is a bit busy to share parking among all other businesses. This is a minus for the location for customers to find parking. 

The interior is great pen space. Plenty of light to see what you eating. I likes the system order your food at counter and they bring it to the table. It is convenient for the customers. 

I have ordered the tuna sandwich. I ask if the tuna is seared. And she acknowledged. However, they serve it fried with coating at outward of tuna. It is different than I was ask. Which is good with me. The tuna is just average because they probably fried from frozen. 

I think their counter clerk need to know what they serve if a customer asking about the the food. Overall is good experience.

Brooklyn Water Bagel is 3.5 stars. The yelp review is on target. The 3 to 4 stars is all base on when they take the first bite on to go order. If the customer take the bite there will be close to 4 stars. If it is to go, it may not be the same experience. 

I have the chorizo bagel. For the price is about at the high side. Like the scrabble egg in it. The chorizo is ok. Food is definitely a breakfast style. As a result they close at 3 pm. May be changed a bit here and there will bring them to better product.

Come here for a drink and checking this place out. Typical bar setup at soho area with one half facing the outside street and the other half facing inside the building. 

We have not try their food. Can said too much about it. However the set up of the bar is nice. The have some selection of the local draft. The beer is in the high side on the happy hour price compare to south Tampa. They do have the foot ball bucket during the game time. They do have good selection of Pinot Noir. 

The only thing I don't like are their complimentary valet parking. If I don't want them to park my car, I cannot park on their lot. I have look for street parking. Sometimes if don't plan and go to this place and you don't want valet, you cannot park there. I do like their service. However, overall cost of drink is a bit higher compare to normal bar.

In search of taco, i decide to be this place since the other taco place is too busy. This place been in my bookmark for some time. This taco bus is the oldest in the Bay Area among all the taco bus. I thought they must has something special item from other taco bus. They did not. 

They open very late to 4 am in the morning. If you cannot find a place to eat at late hours, this place may be open. A yellow bus is a order center. Then you can take your order number and they will bring the food to you.  

The taco is below average from our current taco fever. They may need to improve since Tampa already has many mobile taco open and better. Meat seasoning need to step up. The meat juicy need to preserve when they serve. Overall, I would say this is a jewel in Tampa to symbolize the Tampa.

Bobacup is getting a bit slagging today. A few week ago I find out after 9 pm they don't cook the Hong Kong waffle and we turn away. Last night they completely remove from the menu. Don't understand it. Their reply is not popular item. 

Now they serve crepes with fruit and whip cream. I have order the one with strawberry and banana. Not my liking. When they roll the crepe and try to pack in the fruit in cone shape. It doesn't work. I would rather they lay it flat fold three folds with the fruit inside. It turn out they give out their best product and go to somethings they are not good at. 

Although the boba menu is still there, but the service with no smile, and the quality is not there. A drop of star from my previous review. I wonder some time what define their identity.

This will be the last restaurant to try during the St. Pete restaurant week. We call ahead today and they indicate no reservation is needed. Their outside sitting is very popular. The inside has plenty of room. 

Our first courses are the ceviche and chicken stay skewers. The satay is the best dish tonight. It herb grilled with chilies sauce and peanut glazed. The ceviche is the mahi mahi in lime juice. It just ok compare to most of Peruvian restaurant. 

To night they don't have duck leg so we order two grilled Cobia fish as second course. The Cobia is grill and top with pineapple salsa and avocado purée. I like the accompanying almond rice. Is is very tasty. 

Our final courses are the cheesecake and the strawberry rhubarb pie. The crust of the pie is perfect. The cheesecake is most and good. 

Overall the service is a bit slow. The reason they have 3 stars is no stand out dish. No wow factor and some seafood chain restaurant is better than them. The menu may need to improve to attract. For the price we paid, they may not be the best choice.

With all the hype, I finally make it to this place with a group of yelp friend. This is the second capital taco that is open other than the original from the Land O Lake. I am fan for the original capital taco.

We arrive one hour before it close. The capital taco has strange hour. They close at 8 pm and it is early to my standards. So far they only open 3 day a week. They are planning to open more than 3 days a week. 

I have order the west coast special with tiger shrimp my favorite at the original capital taco and the Johnny Reb. The shrimp is over cook. It is not bouncy. The Jonny Reb is a bit better. Somehow the food on second capital taco do not measure to their original store. 

Other not positive note is they got this big space. However, the seating is too less. Why they want the customer to take it to go or wait on the table since they can have more table. Since they are in the corner store why not add some out door seating. The line is also long, I would said they can take the order on the line like Chick fillets. 

There are many area they can improve. I hope my next visit they can improve.

This place is located very remotely. It got the space it need to hold large group. The kitchen and the order center are separated. Every time they take an order they when to back room to prepare it. It leave the front counter empty. 

The smoothie they prepare is a bit in the sweet side. I think may be the juice they have is sweet. Overall the wait is short. I order the pomegranate plunge. It has good taste. Love the nature drink.

I cannot believe I am actually writing a review for Arby's. in all goodness, I do like their new product. The new pork belly sandwich has attracted me to be here. I have pork belly sandwich at BBQ place before. I just want to see how they fare with their new sandwich. It give you 2 slide of thick pork belly, crispy onions, and smoke cheddar cheese. This combination sound very good. The pork belly was cook harmony and it go well with the crispy onions. It create crunchy taste. The sauce is good. As I did not have lunch and have the late lunch everything taste good. 

I was only one at three o'clock drive through. After paying, it still need to wait for 3 minutes to cook. The drive through lane need to be reconstructed in this location. A lot pot holes that cumulate the dirty water. May be make it more desirable for the drive through experience.

Great drive through. The wait is good but sometime they have hang out with customer and delay the deliver time for the drive through. I like to get the dollar menu during the happy hour time 2-5 pm. I have the Baja freeze and the spicy chicken crunch. The food is good for afternoon snack.

Try their cinnamon ball. Sweet Cream inside

There are not many Boston Market Chicken in Tampa. This location may only one in Temple Terrace. I like the one in New Tampa and decided to try it on this location. 

I think the rotisserie chicken may need some work. The marinated spice did not go enough to the bone. It is important to get the marinated spice into the meat. The other things is the chicken need to grilled a bit more to crispy the skin.  It is the crispy and tasty skin that make the name of the Boston Market. One thing they done very well is the maintenance of juicy meat. This may be due to their good technique. 

I have the three pieces dark meat which is good enough for a meal. It come with two sides of your choice. I had the sweet potatoes yum and the mixed sautéed veggies. This is a good choice. Overall my experience is good.

The Greek goddess always have good healthy food. This Acropolis has been here for long time. But I was surprised to see a slow Friday lunch crowd. I have been to this place on weekday and they have more crowd. 

We were early at 11:30 am. I have order blacken salmon salad special of the day and my wife got the grilled chicken wrap. It take more than the normal air time for the food to come out. The salmon was grilled to perfect but the blacken can be better. I like the salad dressing. The potatoes salad on top of the salad is creative. The grilled chicken can improve a bit better by marinated over night to enhance the flavor and add some salt. 

The decorations of the restaurant is contemporary. However, the booth seat need a new leather refurbished. Service is slow.

I always like Popeyes fried chicken. When first landed in this country, the place I went for college is Louisiana. That time I am not use to burger for my oriental taste. But Popeyes fried chicken is well accepted by my taste. Especially those spicy fried chicken.

I got the spicy chicken strip combo with popcorn shrimp. I like them spicy. The chicken strips are very nice and bread coated. The popcorn shrimp is just so so. I went with the combo. My order is close to nine pm. They already not brew any sweet tea. This store is a bit lazy not accommodate the customers need. I have if they have some on the drive through. They also out of sweet tea. 

A southern food cannot provide sweet tea is not quite accommodating. Not wonder the rating is not high. Many of the waitresses know what I need but walk away from my request. I have been to some other Popeyes and they're not like that.

Keegan have been show on food network when Guy featured in one of his episodes. They have some item that Guy want to try. If you visit their restaurants, there is Guy signature poster in the restaurant. 

The famous dishes include blackened grouper sandwich and charbroiled octopus. This two dishes are the best of the restaurants. I have ordered this two dishes to try. The blackened grouper come with mango chutney. The blackened is one of the kind. It is southern style spice. I like that better. The fish is in good portion.
